author: {'steamid': '76561199096340694', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1708537305}
review:
[i][b]Вчера попробовал love - не впечатлило. А потом я вернулся домой и скачал эту игру.[/b][/i]

Что же такое LOVE? Эм... обычный платформер на точность? Может, LOVE - это любовь к геймдеву, к кропотливому труду за светлым экраном монитора, вождению стилусом по планшету и мешающим спать по ночам  ударам по клавиатуре? Или это любовь к играм, любовь к их простоте и возможности отдохнуть и расслабиться, забыв о проблемах насущных, даже если по ту сторону экрана вам суждено проиграть ещё пару тысяч раз на нещадящих, метко спроектированных уровнях. Может, LOVE - это радость от получения редких достижений, что являются ничтожными в масштабах жизни, но такими радостными и знаковыми в реалиях маленькой игровой комнаты. А может LOVE - это просто LOVE, и играется оно не плохо, скажу я вам.

author: {'steamid': '76561198292086293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1711131645}
review:
Gra LOVE to niezwykle oryginalna i artystyczna platformówka, która łączy w sobie minimalistyczną estetykę z głębokimi emocjami oraz wyzwaniami. W przeciwieństwie do tradycyjnych platformówek, LOVE skupia się bardziej na doświadczeniu estetycznym i emocjonalnym, niż na szybkich skokach i zręcznościowych wyzwaniach.

Jednym z najbardziej charakterystycznych elementów tej gry jest jej unikalna oprawa graficzna. Prosta, geometryczna estetyka i abstrakcyjne formy tworzą niepowtarzalny świat, który wciąga gracza swoją nietypowością i pięknem. Każdy poziom jest starannie zaprojektowany.

Oprócz tego, LOVE oferuje również wspaniałą oprawę dźwiękową, która doskonale współgra z wizualnymi elementami gry, pogłębiając jej atmosferę i uczucia. Ścieżka dźwiękowa jest starannie dopasowana do każdego poziomu, co dodaje grze dodatkowej warstwy emocjonalnej.

Tryb speedrunów skupia się na jak najszybszym przejściu gry od początku do końca. Gracze starają się osiągnąć jak najlepszy czas, używając różnych technik i skrótów, aby przyspieszyć swoje postępy. To wymaga precyzji, doskonałej znajomości poziomów i umiejętności szybkiego reagowania.

Arcade Mode to tryb gry, który może zawierać różnorodne wyzwania lub mini-gry, dodatkowe poziomy, bonusowe przedmioty lub unikalne mechaniki rozgrywki. Może to być sposób na rozszerzenie doświadczenia z podstawowej kampanii lub na wprowadzenie nowych elementów rozgrywki.

Tryb YOLO to ekstremalne wyzwanie, w którym gracz ma tylko jedno życie do ukończenia całej gry. W przypadku śmierci, gracz musi rozpocząć od nowa. Jest to tryb dla graczy poszukujących maksymalnego wyzwania i testu swoich umiejętności.

Oprócz wymienionych powyżej, LOVE może zawierać również inne tryby, takie jak tryb eksploracji, tryb z ograniczonym czasem lub tryb wyzwania, w którym gracz musi spełnić określone warunki, aby zakończyć poziom.

LOVE to nie tylko platformówka, to prawdziwe dzieło sztuki interaktywnej.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1705774206}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review:
we need chinese, we need chinese, we need chinese. 我们需要中文，虽然这个游戏不用。

202304，steam，steam掉卡抵扣，t a o宝，支付宝红包，humble，indie gala，daily indie game，fanatical，杉果，它处自定义包入的本体约4元。爱人如己，目前就这，看以后追评。有中文的游戏请耐心自研体验乐趣，攻略指南尽量不用。不建议使用外挂，插件，作弊之类的，游戏都要这样搞，那现实里那更是如此了。兄弟萌，强烈建议不要第三方平台的小店买y u额，通过饰品等挂steam市场转的，高概率red信乃至封号，且行且珍惜。

author: {'steamid': '76561199231325381', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1703802132}
review:
I've logged a few hours on this one. It's  a great little platformer, and if you like to use the dollars spent to hours of enjoyment ratio,, this one certainly didn't fail to deliver. I actually like the level design of this one better than KUSO. 
I own all three of these games, and I can honestly say that since LOVE 3 include's all of this one and KUSO's levels, it's the only one of the three that you need. However, if you're not sure about buying 2 or 3, go ahead and get this one. It's only $3 and it does go on sale sometimes. 
Honestly, if you're up in the air about this one, go for it. You can probably buy it, play through it once and if you didn't like it, refund it. However, it does have a decent amount of replayability due to speedruns and achievements and stuff. My PB is about 17 minutes, so try and beat that lol

Conclusion: It's short but sweet, and it's hard to imagine a world where you would actually regret purchasing this. 8/10.

review:
The first entry of the LOVE trilogy. While the followup games certainly show Fred Wood's increase in pixeling skills, this game still has all of its original charm - and it even runs at 60fps now! If you already own LOVE 3, you may already know the levels, however this game still includes the original soundtrack music and you get the nice and cozy feeling of having supported the developer some more.

FiveEight out of Ten

review: LOVE. El nombre no tiene mucho sentido porque no es un juego que te ponga tranquilo, eso creo. Es un juego de plataformas 2d con el estilo de los juegos de antaño, tipo ATARI. Simplemente hay un OST del juego el cual me gusta y gozo, su banda sonora es muy buena. Un juego indie desafiante y que si lo encontrás en descuento. Echale una probadita y dale un poco de LOVE. Muy buen juego indie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201246082', 'num_games_owned': 3232, 'num_reviews': 1499, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1681850786}
review:
Love, Fred Wood tarafından 2014 yılında geliştirilen ve yayınlanan zorlu ve görsel olarak çekici bir platform oyunudur. Oyun, zorlu zorluğa, özel yeniden doğma sistemine ve rekabetçi puanlamaya odaklanan retro bir estetiğe sahiptir. Ayrıca, oyuncuların kendi seviyelerini oluşturmalarına olanak tanıyan kullanımı kolay bir seviye oluşturma özelliğine sahiptir.

Oyun, Steam platformunda 770 yorumun "Çok Olumlu" olarak işaretlenmesiyle çok sayıda olumlu yorum aldı. Oyuncular oyunun zorlu seviyelerini, benzersiz yeniden doğma sistemini ve oyuna derinlik katan rekabetçi puanlama sistemini takdir ediyor.

Oyunda her biri kendi zorlukları ve engelleri olan 16 seviye bulunuyor. Oyuncular ayrıca kolay, normal ve yoğun rekabet için speedrun modu dahil olmak üzere çeşitli oyun modları arasından seçim yapabilirler. Oyun ayrıca oyuncuların kendi seviyelerini oluşturmalarına ve başkalarıyla paylaşmalarına olanak tanıyan bir seviye editörü de içeriyor.

James Bennett tarafından bestelenen oyunun müzikleri mükemmeldir ve basit 3 renkli atmosferi hayata geçirir. Oyunun grafikleri de cazibesine cazibe katan retro bir estetikle görsel olarak çekici.

Özetle Love, benzersiz bir oyun deneyimi sunan zorlu ve keyifli bir platform oyunudur. Özel yeniden doğma sistemi, rekabetçi puanlama ve seviye oluşturma özelliği, platform oyunlarından hoşlanan oyuncular için ilgi çekici bir seçimdir. Eğer retro platform oyunlarını seviyorsanız, Love kesinlikle denemeye değer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128239804', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1664156813}
review:
Love es un juego minimalista de plataformas, que te entretendrá por unas pocas horas y que compensa sus gráficos simplistas con una jugabilidad excelente.
El juego cuenta con unos gráficos muy simples, con un estilo retro muy pixelado y simulando la paleta de colores que podíamos encontrar en los ordenadores del pasado. El protagonista, apenas se presenta como seis líneas unidas para formar una especie de humanoide digno de la Atari 2600.
La música acompaña, sin ser estridente ni demasiado pegadiza. Olvidable.
La jugabilidad es excelente. Los movimientos del personaje son sencillos y precisos, y los saltos tienen un grado de precisión muy ajustado que permite controlarlos con comodidad. Los controles son justamente esos, no hay más, a excepción de la colocación de los checkpoints en algunos modos de juego.
La durabilidad no es demasiado elevada. Es cierto que contamos con varios modos de juego, entre los que destacan el modo Arcade, Speedrun y Yolo, pero sus 16 niveles los pasaremos sin excesiva dificultad y tan solo alargaremos la vida del título intentado conseguir los diferentes logros, o intentando estar entre los primeros puestos de la lista de Highscores.
Al final, un título entretenido, sin más. Bien hecho dentro de su estética simplista y con un diseño peculiar. No es un imprescindible, pero si te gustan este tipo de juegos, seguro te divertirá por unas pocas horas.

NOTA: 6,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199024139023', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1661999181}

author: {'steamid': '76561198134958103', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1705302280}
review:
완전 픽셀 글래픽 게임이라 제 취향이라서 재미있게 했습니다.
괜찮은 난이도와 적절한 세이브가 있어서 누구나 적당하게 플레이 할수 있지 않나 싶네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001148159', 'num_games_owned': 1018, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1546304964}
review:
[h1]I really like this game. You probably shouldn't buy it.[/h1]

There are games which are surpassed in every way by their sequels. LOVE... isn't quite that, but kuso does have one thing in its favour: all the main campaign levels from LOVE in it. The physics are the same (or close to it, haven't played this one in a while) and there have been some minor tweaks, but it's still the bulk of this game. This one retains a few exclusive levels, but unless you're really strapped for cash (or if you want to further support the developer), you should grab kuso.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/578930/LOVE_2_kuso/

Oh, you want a proper content review? It's a semi-minimalistic platformer. Some levels do introduce special mechanics to spice things up a bit, but for the bulk of your run all you do is avoid obstacles and run. You have infinitely placeable checkpoints which does let you adjust your challenge level, and if you play in normal mode you'll get a fair challenge. Some of the timings take a whole to get used, but you're unlikely to ragequit. I wouldn't quite call it zen like with some other platformers (both easier and harder), but you can easily get yourself semi-tranced by it. Even if the game is just pixel art and your character is a literal stickman, the aesthetics are great (some of these levels are gorgeous) with a catchy soundtrack.

review: Fun playformer game. It's very short and you can probably beat it in under an hour. You can do speedruns if that is your thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067347675', 'num_games_owned': 1397, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1656737660}
review:
LOVE is an enjoyable retro styled micro-platformer that has many varied mechanics and setups for the few levels it contains. The game is very short with the 'main campaign' containing only 16 levels, and nothing is really very difficult. The game puts a big focus on going back to speedrun or no-death the levels/game to encourage replayability and it can be fun to do so. The only real issue I had with the game is the music can get quite repetitive since multiple of the tunes are re-used on several levels, and are also a rather short loop. Continually hearing them while grinding for the YOLO achievement was a bit grating, but you can always disable it.

All in all a nice little platformer that often even goes on sale for $1 - definitely recommended for platformer fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028205782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1656046439}
review:
비슷한 장르의 게임과 차별점은
- 스크린 이동이 없어 끊김 없이 진행할 수 있다.
- 짧은 반복 메모리를 가진 BGM
- 그 BGM의 리듬과 동일한 타이밍으로 움직이는 다양한 기믹
- 따라서 리듬 게임적인 느낌도 받을 수 있다.
- '흰색: 닿으면 죽음, 다른 색: 지형임'이라는 쉬운 구별
- 여러가지 무늬를 사용하여 연출하는 독특한 분위기

단점은 상당히 짧다는 것. 총 100번 가까이 죽었으나 30분 정도에 모든 맵을 경험하였다.
하지만 독특한 분위기를 가지므로 해당 장르를 좋아한다면 해 볼만 하다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000564041', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1672509021}
review:
In my opinion this is a perfect platformer for people who don't like platformers.  I know because I'm one of those people.  Usually the act of jumping between 2d blocks bores me to tears and the frustrating trial and error that often accompanies it doesn't help matters.  

Love is an exception to that rule.  

There's something about the simplicity and directness of its gameplay that's really appealing.  There's not much in the way of momentum or friction to worry about, so landing precise jumps is really just a matter of pressing and releasing jump/movement at the right time.  It feels very responsive and precise, and makes chaining together sequences of jumps very satisfying and easy to grasp, even for someone who doesn't have years of platformer muscle memory.  And... that's about all you have to worry about.  You run and jump.  Each level has varied and unique obstacles that challenge your timing or reactions, but there's never anything overly complex.  

This isn't a criticism, mind you.  As I said, I think the simplicity of Love works to its advantage.  It's easy to get into, easy to enjoy.  Easy to look at too, with its appealing almost-monochromatic abstract shapes sometimes implying a grounded place and sometimes just creating pretty patterns.  And easy to consume for another important reason: the checkpoint system.  In Love you have complete control over where checkpoints are placed, and an infinite supply of them.  In other words, if a specific jump is giving you trouble, you simply place a checkpoint right there and boom, you respawn right there every time you die.  On the default mode you're limited to 100 lives, but there's a mode with infinite lives as well, and that ends up being a surprisingly relaxing experience.  Just keep trying until you get it, no pressure.  And once you're comfortable with the game and the challenges it presents, there are other more difficult modes, including one where you only have a single life.

tl;dr a simple appealing little game that makes platforming fun and chill, even if you don't usually find platforming either fun or chill.  Recommended at the asking price, HIGHLY recommended on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036538203', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1618930812}
review:
LOVE is a very basic platformer- and by that I mean very basic. There are no enemy creatures or characters, and just as well because you have no means of attack. You also have no special or fancy thing you can do, like a dash or a hover.

This game is just the player, the character sprite, the world, movement keys, and the jump button, and gameplay involves getting around the obstacles and platforms without falling into anything dangerous.

This is a very challenging and skill-expecting experience, as a matter of fact. The player character- if it can be called a 'character'- is very responsive to our input. That includes the arrow keys as well as the jump button, which means that down to the individual in-game step what you're pressing matters. There is not any sideways momentum even in mid-air, which can be disorienting for a Sonic the Hedgehog fanboy like me, but as one gets used to it this non-momentum lends itself well to the much-needed precision for platforming and fall-directing.

I admit that it's normally not my cup of tea- I long to play as characters who have teeth and something a little more to their basic mechanics- but the simple challenge grew on me, largely with the help of the presentation, which despite the game's complete lack of story or lore sets up a noteworthy, eerie world that seems to imply a story of its own. The visuals are compounded by a soundtrack that can be said likewise.

Combine this with the reasonable asking price- three dollars- and I recommend this for anyone who likes 2D platformers, required precision for play, and who doesn't mind having only the absolute basics to work with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300270231', 'num_games_owned': 5385, 'num_reviews': 894, 'playtime_forever': 1176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1578224317}
review: 겉으로 보기에는 굉장히 사랑스러우나, 그 속을 헤아릴수록 증오를 품게 만드는 게임. 그래픽은 예전 아타리 게임의 감성을 느낄 수 있으며, 정겨운 8비트 전자음이 고막을 때리는 사운드는 절로 리듬을 타게 한다. 심지어 조작도 매우 부드러운 편. 조작에 하자가 없어서 변명도 못하고 무조건 실력빨이다 이건. 개인마다 차이가 있겠지만, 일단 2시간 정도 하면 노말 게임 'A등급'과 스피드런 '12분 이내 완주' 도전과제는 할 만하다. 문제는 'A++ 등급'과 'YOLO 모드 클리어' 도전과제인데··· 난이도가 갑자기 아득한 우주마냥 팍 차원을 이동한 수준으로 가혹하다. 아니 이게 목숨 하나만 가지고 클리어하는 게 가능한가? 현재 전성기 기록도 죽은 횟수 13번인데··· 눈앞이 깜깜하다. 플랫폼 장르로써 게임성 자체는 나쁘지 않기에 엄지는 올리겠다. 일단 불합리한 구간은 없거든.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202141575', 'num_games_owned': 2588, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1614884574}
review:
So far LOVE seems like a really cool retro platformer.

And I suck at platformers.

But I have still been enjoying this one!

The game has a cool system where you yourself can set the checkpoint wherever you are by pressing S, makes it a lot less tedious.

Arbitrary scores:
Action: B+
Music: Retro, B+
Forgiveness: A
Mechanics: Cool, A-
Graphics: Retro, alright, B-

author: {'steamid': '76561198052933734', 'num_games_owned': 4633, 'num_reviews': 571, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1588090032}
review:
ドット絵で構成されたミニマルデザインが印象的な
高難易度死に覚えアクションゲーム｡
全16面｡基本操作は移動とジャンプだけだが
残機は100もあり､道中に好きなだけリスポーン地点を作れる｡
そんな愛にあふれた仕様のおかげで､クリアするだけなら余裕｡

しかし本作には､残機なし・リスポ地点作成不可モードが存在し､
そのクリア実績が用意されている｡
それが意味するところは､「この過酷な条件でクリアしてみろ」
という作者からの挑戦状にほかならず､自ずと
このモードこそが本作の真の姿なのだと気付かされることになる｡
その難易度は鬼畜と呼ぶほかなく､そこにはもはや
愛の欠片も見当たらない｡温かみを感じられたドット絵からは
冷たく無機質な殺意しか感じられなくなる｡
この上げて落とす感触が新鮮で､意味深なゲーム名も相まって
同ジャンルのゲームとしてオンリーワンの存在感を放っている｡

筆者の場合､数え切れないほどのリプレイを繰り返して
全実績解除まで10時間だった｡実績にこだわらないなら
幅広い層におすすめできるカジュアル死にゲーだが
マゾゲー好きには特に強く勧めたい力作｡BGMもとても良い｡

author: {'steamid': '76561198022333022', 'num_games_owned': 5915, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1603920049}
review:
Played this on and off for a week at the start of the year. Have come back to it at the end. 16 short stages, 100 lives, set your own checkpoints. How hard can it be?

Pretty hard as it turns out. My first completion took 99 of my 100 lives. The end screen rewarded me with a D- grade. My second, was much improved. An A- with around 40 deaths. The game was 'beaten' but I really felt like I could do a bit more with practice. By the time I finally received my coveted A++ today, I had slimmed down my statistics to just 12 deaths, 14 checkpoints.

I loved how tangible progress felt over the runs, even if I got frustrated sometimes when I messed up bits I knew I could do better at. The game got a remake / sequel called Kuso, but it was expanded from 16 to 40+ levels and I've always been a bit concerned that it would have lost some of its learnable purity in the transition.

A very good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198429107074', 'num_games_owned': 936, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1606840291}
review: LOVE is an extremely well designed game for such a small development team. It's elegant in its simplicity. One button to jump, one button to place a re-spawn point. It's very simple to play, much harder to master.That's where LOVE really shines. Replay value. When fully utilizing the re-spawn points and the 100 lives, it's not terribly difficult to clear all of the levels. But, if you expect to get a decent score or unlock the rank achievements, you'll need to play multiple times, memorizing the levels, and clearing the game with fewer lives lost and fewer re-spawn points placed. It's just difficult enough to keep you coming back for more.At the time of this review, I have not unlocked the YOLO achievement or the A++ ranking. I will probably leave these two achievements, as perfecting the levels is fun, but also frustrating at times. I may return again someday to attempt these, but for now I'd rather leave with my positive memories of the game still intact.What this game does right:- Controls are tight- Level design, for the most part-Graphics that are reminiscent of the Atari era- High level of replay value through the ranking system, speedrun mode, and yolo mode.- The music is excellentWhat this game could do better:- Occasional inconsistency (Rarely, certain bouncers won't register a high jump, only a small jump)- Requires pixel perfect jumps in certain areas (groups of spikes, level three shortcut, etc.)- Some levels are significantly easier/harder than others, but not necessarily in order of appearance- Main game is shortCan I recommend this game? Absolutely! It's a short game. However, the replay value more than makes up for this. If you don't enjoy replaying the same levels over and over, this game may not be for you. But, for everyone else, it's a worthy addition to your ever expanding Steam library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069101936', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1689216314}
review:
Jogo simples e curto de plataforma, muita cara de um jogo que você encontraria no Newgrounds, com uma pegada "hardcore". Apesar de outros jogos similares serem mais difíceis, esse aqui não é moleza não,
Pura tentativa e erro, sendo que qualquer mexidinha por mais leve que seja vai te levar pro fundo da vala. 
Eu sou horrível nesse estilo de plataformer, então não posso opinar muito, mas creio que te desafia de forma competente.
A trilha sonora é uma amálgama de música de Geometry Dash com uma pegada meio beat-tape/lo-fi. Impressionantemente boa e relaxante.
6,50 não compra nem um sonho de valsa hoje em dia, mas eu recomendaria esperar por alguma promoção, quando ele fica mais barato ainda, se você for pão-duro. (eu tbm sou rlx)

author: {'steamid': '76561198340847703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 310, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1599130190}
review:
Genre:  
-Minimalist Precision Platformer

Fit for me:
-Perfect fit!

Notes:
-I played 3 modes and finished all 3.  I completed the normal arcade mode w/ unlimited lives, the harder mode w/ 100 lives, and the remix levels w/ 25 lives.  

Pros:
-Very easy to learn and play
-Very simple, clean aesthetic w/ solid lines and different colors for each level
-Each level has a distinct theme and implements new platforming challenges
-Solo Dev that understands what makes a platformer fun
-Solid soundtrack that matches the mood of the game but isn't overbearing
-Good jumping mechanics and solid responsiveness
-Cheap as balls for under $3 and is on sale frequently

Cons:
-Very short, you can beat the 3 main modes in under 2 hrs
-Not as dynamic both mechanically and visually as better games in the genre
-A bit of a one trick pony 
-Limited options is traversing the world compared to other platformers

Thoughts:
-I bought this a few months ago for around $1 and I'm happy w/ that purchase.  This game is very simple, but is better than it looks.  It doesn't stack up to the big guns in the genre, but for that price point, it dosn't have to.  It's a serviceable game that die-hards of the genre should give a try.  It finds a way to carve it's own path in the very saturated precision platformer genre.

Consensus:
-Middle of the Road Game (Tier 4 and makes up 25% of my reviews).  Support a dev that has spent a lot of time and effort creating a fun, nostalgic experience that brings you back to simpler gaming times.  It's cheap as balls and a worthy addition to any gamer's library.  I'm planning to play the sequel Love 2:  Kusso soon, looking forward to it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198837947230', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1622283372}
review:
This game is amazing. Even though it's a simple platformer, and short [spoiler]there are 16 main levels, 7? remix levels, and 3 kuso levels[/spoiler]. But each level only takes maybe a minute or two to complete on your first go, and even less the better you get., I found myself replaying levels to get better times, finding shortcuts, and getting a better understanding of the games mechanics. It also has a level editor, but I haven't tried it out yet. I really recommend this game, even at full price.

Let's start with what I like about the game:

1. It's price. At only $3, I feel like it is well worth it. There are games out there that give you less at double the cost

2. The music. Every level has it's own song, and I am a huge fan of music like this. Check out the LOVE ost by James Bennett on bandcamp to listen to some of the music. 

3. The gameplay / controls. The controls are very smooth and responsive. I think you only move at one speed, and you stop moving as soon as you let go. This keeps you in complete control. I never came across any glitches, or felt like I died because of the controls. And because of the graphics, it's easy to tell what you can and can't interact with. You also get unlimited check points to place wherever you want. If a jump looks tough, just place a checkpoint before you go. There are also modes with limited lives and such, for those looking to keep things challenging. 

4. The graphic. They are very simple. Each level has it's own color, helping it stand out. The limited palette each level has really helps bring each element of a level together, and the black background helps those elements pop and stand out. 

5. The atmosphere. I can't describe it, but the music and the graphics really compliment each other. Sometimes, I want to take my time in a level just to enjoy it.

6. The level design. Each level is unique and stands out on it's own. Not just because of the art and the music, but because of the game play elements introduced in each level. Levels will sometimes re-use elements from a previous level, but never feel like a rehash.

7. How easy it is to practice. Like I said above, you get unlimited checkpoints to place anywhere on the ground, unless you put it in an obstacles way, then it will be destroyed. This, combined with the fact that you can practice any level at any time, makes practicing tough parts very accessible. There is a jump in a level I was having a lot of trouble on. So I just loaded that level from the level select, put a checkpoint before that jump, and practiced it over and over until I got the timing down. Surprisingly, having unlimited checkpoints does not make the game too easy, and actually makes me want to see this in other games. 

Now for the short list of what I didn't like: 

1. The design of a couple of levels. One has a bunch of bouncing platforms moving up and down, and it's very difficult to get the timing right. I get through it with luck every time. And another level has platforms that move on a set path, and it's not too hard, but you have to wait a while for enough platforms to appear before you can even complete the level. 

2. As I make attempt after attempt at getting the YOLO achievement, I become more and more irritated that it was easier to get this (and other difficult achievements) in the past. Partly due to glitches, and mostly due to the fact that there used to be 12 main levels, instead of the current [spoiler]16[/spoiler]. More levels is definitely good, but I don't agree with making an achievement significantly harder after so many people have gotten it. I would have been fine with adding another achievement for all 16 levels (although I don't know how adding achievements works with steam, so it may not have been possible.) Or even better, just keep the achievement for the original 12 levels. Sadly (for me at least), the developer doesn't seem to have any interest in changing this. And that's fine. I mean, more levels being added is still technically a positive. I'll just have to keep trying for it. The game is still enjoyable enough to keep trying, and the new levels, while challenging, don't seem too unfair.

In closing, with so many positives, and only a couple of negatives that won't affect most people, I strongly recommend this game, even at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327724097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1679456241}
review:
I want to start out by saying that since a recommendation or a non-recommendation is equated with a good or bad review,  I chose to give this game a recommendation. That said, I would not recommend this game to a friend. That doesn't mean it's a bad game, quite the opposite. I just couldn't recommend it to someone. 

It's a reasonably difficult platformer, rather difficult for the amount of time I put into it. That being said, it's a good game and definitely worthy of some speedrunning competitions, I just couldn't get the hang of it.

The graphics are minimal, but enough to get the point across. Mechanics are simple, but difficult to master.

Overall a good game, I just couldn't recommend it. 

If the devs are reading this, I'd love to see more levels added, or perhaps an expansion. I know you guys are passionate about your work, and I support that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150107495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1593206070}
review:
At first glance, LOVE reminded me of VVVVVV. Unfortunately, it doesn't possess the cleverness and charm of the latter. Although the obstacles you have to overcome are diverse, none of them is memorable. And the game is very short, lasting maybe half an hour on the first approach.

There are many different play modes, including a speedrun mode with leaderboards, and bonus levels. And true to the promises, LOVE is difficult, though maybe not when compared to others like Super Meat Boy. Finally, the soundtrack is surprisingly good. I enjoyed it.

But all in all, I don't think it's worth an average gamer's time. It might be of interest to fans of super-hard games who already beat all the famous ones. For the price, it's not a terrible deal. But you're probably not going to remember this game after beating it a couple of times.

PS. If you get it, try playing with your keyboard. In my experience, playing LOVE with a gamepad doesn't feel good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012473463', 'num_games_owned': 4077, 'num_reviews': 418, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1563499911}
review:
[h1]Follow our [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36214917/]Curator Group for more reviews[/url][/h1]
LOVE is a hardcore platformer with a range of difficulty options for every type of player.

The levels are designed very well and each has a unique theme, as well as unique platforming challenges. You won’t encounter any repetitive level design because of how creatively structured each level is. Because they are all so different, dying is inevitable and a major part of the game.

The normal difficulty level gives you 100 lives and unlimited checkpoints, which must be manually placed. Harder difficulties add more restrictions, but most people will have the best experience at the default difficulty. The controls are fluid and precise, ensuring every death feels like you made a mistake, rather than the game tripping you up with a cheap trap.

Graphically, the game is great, with some top tier pixel art. Each level looks completely different, and a lot of that is because of the stylistic choices for each background theme.

The soundtrack is solid and works well with the short game length to help ensure it doesn’t get repetitive. LOVE is an all-around good game, without any major flaws, aside from, arguably, its length.

7/10
[quote]
Visit our [url=https://www.mmmreviews.com]website[/url] for more in-depth reviews and recommendations
[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198061106404', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1688146066}
review:
LOVE убрала всё лишнее, оставив только нужный для удовольствия геймплей. Игра сложная, но сложность нарастает адекватно, и на 100-й раз уровень, который вызывал сложность, проходится за 1-2 жизни. LOVE вызывает дикие эмоции, практически любое завершение этой игры это rage-quit. Когда ты проходишь сложный кусок уровня, а потом теряешь жизнь на какой-то ерунде, то нервы не выдерживают, но этот платформет и должнен быть таким.
Играть можно под какой-нибудь подкаст или с полной концентрацией. Короче, если вам нравится геймплей платформеров и вас не пугает сложность, то это отличная игра, которая гениально сделана с геймплейной точки зрения.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120560745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1585819005}
review: Отличный платформер, на который отчего-то забыла написать обзор: прошла довольно давно, и сейчас вернулась перепройти из-за небольшого апдейта и трех новых уровней. Короткий, но прекрасно выверенный и атмосферный, проходится с удовольствием и по несколько раз. В меру сложный: на некоторых местах подгорает, на некоторых ловишь флоу и проходишь плавно аки лебедушка. Саундтрек просто мвах, кайфуешь, пока играешь, а композиция с 4го уровня и вовсе у меня в плейлисте. Рекомендую от души, стоит своих денег и нескольких часов жизни, чтобы насладиться геймплеем и музыкой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058159844', 'num_games_owned': 1055, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1583745458}
review:
An hour ago I wouldn’t have been able to tell you what it means for a platformer to be ‘reductive’, but now I am enlightened. [i]Love[/i] sells itself as one such platformer, and always looking for new things, I thought I should install this from my massive backlog and learn what that is. I know now, and it turns out it’s not too big a difference between that and the game’s second selling point: a ‘retro aesthetic’. Turns out ‘reductive’ just means ‘it’s literally just a NES game’. We’re better than this, guys. Retro-style was fun for a while, but most games that do it well turn out to be good thanks to their own innovation in gameplay and design, not because they’re doing the same things people were playing in 1988.

What do you want me to tell you about [i]Love[/i]? The only controls are a short jump and an ability that moves your latest checkpoint to the spot where you’re currently standing, but that’s not really ‘innovation’, it’s more ‘playing NES games on an emulator and binding the save and load state buttons to your controller’. There’s nothing new here, and if you’d asked me as a newborn in 1999, he’d probably also have told you that this is just derivative shit with nothing new to offer that you couldn’t get on a Game & Watch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048297354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1424032497}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044364065', 'num_games_owned': 1590, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1566080485}
review: LOVE is a short but difficult precision platformer with high replay value. Unless you're doing a YOLO run, you can place checkpoints yourself, anywhere, so dying should never send you too far back. To improve your score in later runs, you'll want to use as few checkpoints as possible, while at the same time you'll try to make less mistakes. All 16 levels are very distinct from each other, and most even have their own music track.

review:
Edit: Dev patched to 60fps!!! Thank you so much!

Pretty good precision platformer, although the one big thing that hurts it is the 30fps cap. It doesn't ruin the game, but it takes some time to adjust for input latency and when the screen scrolls it has that juddery feel.

Nonetheless it's still a fun albeit short experience. If you enjoy platformers than definitely give this one a shot on sale.

review:
RECOMMENDED

Fun little platformer. Not so hard that it makes you want to ragequit. It's addictive enough to keep you wanting to keep trying. I'm not a big "difficult" platformer player, but I've gotten all the achievements except for the speedrun and no death achievements. Good level design. This game has a nice style. For .59 I think it's a no-brainer to buy it. One of the better cheap games out there. I'd easily pay 1.99 for it, so .59 on sale is a bargain in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120448985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1558752856}
review: Eh, it's okay.  The music is nice and the platforming is challenging if you want to go for arcade or harder.  I think the graphics are cool but I feel like they'd work better for a minimalistic-style Metroidvania instead of a dollar bin platformer with little to do besides your usual score-chasing; Fred Wood, if you're reading this, you've got great talent for challenging platforming, and I feel like you could made a masterpiece if you tried to expand LOVE with adventure mechanics or something that engages you more with the Atari style industrial world.  I'm pretty sure this goes on sale during the summer and winter sales; I'd wait to purchase it then because it's not worth 3 dollars.  If you like platformers like this that have a more fleshed out design (And also a level editor), try out N++.

author: {'steamid': '76561198408768447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1558647188}
review: This game is about as minimalistic as a platformer can get – back to basics with just running and precision jumping. The core game mechanic is well executed and playing LOVE was definitely a lot of fun, albeit a bit too short. The custom checkpoint feature is really appreciated and you can play at various difficulty settings, so players of all skill levels can enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059684296', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1604590597}
review:
Basic, yet challenging little 8-bit platformer. The different modes give the game some replayability as it is fairly short with only 16 Levels in the main game plus some extra ones. Don't be fooled however, you'll be stuck on those levels for quite some time. The speedrun mode lets you try shave off those extra couple seconds here and there to post the best time. Satisfying solid platformer and a great game if like going for those achievements.

7/10 - LOVE is complicated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198824302304', 'num_games_owned': 886, 'num_reviews': 552, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1580441839}
review:
It's a pretty funny game, there is quite some variety in the levels and it is an actual challenge, even in the 100-lives mode. But for a game this pixelated the hitboxes are not so good, which can be annnoying from time to time.
Then there is the music, wihch is on purpose made like it's recorded in 1960, which I don't like, but there seem to be people who do.

The worst thing and the main reason why I will not recommend this game is because the game haas no restart button, or even an option to go back to the menu if you don't finish the level (or die 100 times) Even worse, when you go somewhere in the menu, you can't go back, which is just ridiculously annoying because you have to restart every time you misclick something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037950334', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1550845003}
review:
Despite its title this is not a dating sim but a simple yet complete minimalistic platformer with some good chilling soundtrack.

 This is the kind of game that doesn't try to reinvent the wheel (like Super Meat Boy or any "hardcore platformer" out there) but tries to give a pure platforming experience.

The game's graphisms are mostly monochromatic (white + one specific color per level), it kinda reminds me of an old 8-bits microcomputer (that couldn't show more than 2 color at once for exemple) but you can always see where your character is and it is never confusing.

The game can be easy in the firsts mode where you can choose to have infinite or 100 live (good to get used to the level design at your own pace), you can set up your own checkpoints (be careful, if a projectile/trap touches the checkpoint it disapears and you have to redo the entire level) but the main difficulty for the game it to do it while dying the least time possible, avoid to set up checkpoints or/and speedrunning it to reach the A++ score.

The only downsides is the fact it runs at 30 FPS (which may looks rough to some people) and the fact that Kuso, it's spiritual sequel, is already out and better in almost every way than this game. But don't worry, you can buy both for a reduced price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022143876', 'num_games_owned': 2643, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 1974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1448, 'last_played': 1669828648}
review:
Fun minimalist platformer. The mechanic of leaving a spawn point whenever and whereever you want makes it really chilled out despite the hard levels. Because of this, my kids ended up really liking this game.

We just got Kuso. The levels are better designed but way harder with more restrictive spawn rules. It's fun but way less chill.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030299179', 'num_games_owned': 2864, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1555312276}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970859560', 'num_games_owned': 5618, 'num_reviews': 358, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1548654238}
review: Well, I wouldn't recommend it, because the pixel-perfect platform schtick doesn't appeal to me. If you like that, then you might like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143157509', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1548262737}
review:
I do not like this game, only get it if you’re really into precision platformers. 

The controls are strict and don’t get it confused with responsiveness, which is essential for a precision platformer to be good. I’m okay with the movement but the jump mechanic is my nemesis. There’s zero leniency in buffering a jump, press jump one frame earlier to your landing or one frame sooner when walking off the ledge and the input would be eaten. This happened to me several times when I was walking down a “slope”, that is pixelated staircases to be precise. Honestly, it’s not that bad if you can take it slow, but some levels have tight cycles that reward speed, and you’re likely to run off the ledge if your jump did not register on a teeny-tiny platform. However, I must concede that I’m not particularly good at precision platformers, thus the frustration, let’s put aside this and talk about actual bad designs.

Level 10 has moving bouncing pads that carry you around, but they only start to appear when you enter the level, so you’d have to wait for them to proceed. The level is around 70 sec and two thirds of the time were spent waiting. Level 11 has dripping acid from the ceiling that’s deadly, but also the same cinematic in the background that doesn’t kill you. Usually you want the scene to stand out from the background for better visual cues.  

It didn’t take me long to beat the game without dying but it sure felt as frustrating as deathless runs that are longer and harder. Overall, it’s not too bad, and I’ll try the sequel to see if there’s any improvement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160755391', 'num_games_owned': 1362, 'num_reviews': 383, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1544732004}
review:
LOVE – платформер.

Хардкорных платформер в котором можно самостоятельно ставить сейвпоинт там, где вам захочется. Этот платформер изначально разработан как тренировочный полигон для любителей спидрана. Цель спидрана в том чтобы пройти игру за наименьший промежуток времени в рамках соревнования или для развлечения.

Не сказать что игра сложная, но она требует от вас предельной концентрации. Каждая смерть персонажа будет отдалять вас от заветного рекорда. Достижения в игре как бы намекают, что если вы всерьёз не планируете заниматься спидраном, то вы не получите и пяти достижений. Можно поставить лёгкий режим, где вы получите бесконечное количество сохранений, но разве это интересно? Так же хочу отметить, что наличие контролёра для этой игре строго обязательно, заниматься спидраном платформера с клавиатуры это то ещё испытание.

Игра сделана в очень простом стиле олдскул игр, управление послушное, механика приятная. Советую обязательно попробовать, быть может у вас стальные нервы, тогда спидран вам придётся по душе.

review: This game goes straight to the point, which I appreciate. Platforming. Basic platforming. Everything is clear to you, and (almost) every death is your own fault. You can also place your own checkpoints to make the game less or more challenging, to your liking. My only gripe with it is that it's not compatible with any of my 3 controllers... But hey, joytokey has been around for years!

author: {'steamid': '76561198279204238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1664327639}
review:
I keep coming back to Love for a fun, challenging, platform experience. It works well as a casual game. 
The graphics absolutely transport me back to days of the Commodore 64, but the gameplay is more fluid and modern in feel. The levels are well-crafted and engaging - challenging without being overly frustrating (this is no Meatboy).
There are a variety of modes to play on, mostly coming down to how many lives you're given for the run.

For the price, it's a great, little game to pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031313794', 'num_games_owned': 8531, 'num_reviews': 3393, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1544436226}
review:
[h1]Описание:[/h1]
Хардкорный платформер в графической стилистике 80х годов. 16 уровней + дополнительные. Прыгаем, стараемся не умереть. Уровни все разные и в меру сложные. Есть несколько режимов игры, как для самых ультра хардкорщиков так и для людей, которые хотят раслабиться и получить удовольствие. Саунд неплохой, графика тоже выполнена отлично. Я застрял на пасти динозавра играя вообще без чекпойнтов, когда вспомнил, что они есть то назад к прохождению вернуться уже нельзя было (нужно проходить всю игру за 1 раз в режиме аркады и других режимах). Конечно можно в любой момент запустить любой уровень, но это уже не то... В целом рекомендую. Неплохая игра.

[h1]Оценка: 6/10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]
Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в группу
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компани

author: {'steamid': '76561198037809811', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1541596559}
review:
[h1]In Short[/h1]

LOVE is an Old School 8-bit platformer. There are 16 levels in the game, each has their own theme and soundtrack every level introduces a new mechanic/idea so every level is different.

[b]🔵 Pros[/b]
+Good looking 8-bit graphics
+Good soundtrack
+Every level has their own theme and there's a good amount of them

[b]🔴 Cons[/b]
-The game is quite short with no real replay value unless you like speedrunning games.

[h1]🎮 In-Depth Gameplay Analysis[/h1]
LOVE is a challenging platformer where your goal is to beat the 16 levels in the game. There are several game modes that will change the amount of lives, checkpoints and other things you have.
For example, you have an easy mode which is unlimited lives and checkpoints, an arcade mode where you only have 100 lives and unlimited checkpoints and there is a yolo mode where you only have 1 life but unlimited checkpoints,
there is also a speedrun mode where you have unlimited lives and you just need to complete the game as fast as possible, and a REMIX mode where you play through 7 remixed levels.
The core gameplay of the game is simple and just what you would expect from a platformer you can perform a single jump, set checkpoints and kill yourself so you spawn at your last checkpoint.

The checkpoint system allows you to set checkpoints around the level so that when you die you spawn on the checkpoints instead of the start of the level. You can set as many checkpoints as you want in no modes and there is no cooldown to them
meaning that you can literally spam your checkpoint button all the time so you're always setting a checkpoint so you never need to backtrack.
If you fell off a platform for example and went back to the start of the level you don't need to go all the way back to where you were if you set a checkpoint since you can just press a button that will kill you and spawn you on your last checkpoint. 
You do however lose a life from this so you might not want to always use it if it's not a long way back to your checkpoint.

The game has 16 levels in the core game modes, 1 bonus level, and 7 remix levels. The core games 16 levels all have a different theme, song and usually they introduce a new gameplay mechanic, for example, there are levels with giant worms that can kill you, ice platforms that move along with you and levels with low gravity zones.
The remixed levels take parts of the core games levels and mix them into several levels. So you might find a lot of different things from the core games levels mixed into 1 level. 

[b]💰 Content & Pricing[/b]
The game costs 2.39€ and took me 30 minutes to complete on my first run so if you're only looking to beat the game once it might not be worth it.
If you like speedrunning games it's another thing. The game's levels never change so it's a good game to speedrun there are also no glitches or bugs that could be abused to skip parts of the game so it's all about skill in this one.

[h1]Technical analysis[/h1]

[b]🎥 Graphics and 🔩 Performance[/b]
The game has simple and good looking 8-bit sprites, every sprite and level is very minimalistic since most levels consist of only one color and there aren't any complicated sprites in them.
The game is capped at 30 fps and has little resolution options, because of the 30 fps cap the game isn't very smooth especially when the camera is moving.
The game does run well though and it should on almost every setup since the graphics are so simple. (GTX 680, I7-7700K, 16GB DDR4)

[b]🎶 Soundtrack[/b]
The soundtrack is very good it really has a Sci-Fi and 8-bit feel to it. The game has all kinds of songs ranging from slow and calm songs to fast and aggressive songs.
The songs don't loop very well and they're very short so you will hear pauses a lot in the songs if you're stuck on a level. The songs also fit every levels theme well. The soundtrack is purchasable as a DLC for 1€.

[b]🐛 Bugs[/b]
I didn't find any bugs with the game.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
LOVE is a solid platformer it's quite challenging and is a good game for speedrunning. The graphics are simplistic and the game's soundtrack is really good.
If you like speedrunning or just seeing improvement in your playing while shaving seconds off your time this is a game for you.

[b]Rating 8/10[/b]

[b]Review based on version 14[/b]

[b]This copy of the game was received for free for review purposes[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1643040856}
review:
Tags: Platformer
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Rage/Retry oriented platformer with atari presentation and tearing of assets during screenscrolling. Audio does not make up for cheap tilesets. Simplistic level design with tight success margins. Controls lack fluidity.

While the controls are responsive the animation for it feels to sometimes akwardly jump pixels and there is an almost lane-like feeling to positioning that I found stiff and did not appreciate.

The atari sprites are poor. No excuses or nostalgia will make up for that. The audio is hit or miss depending on audience, it is generic sounding electronic music.

There is no plot per say and there are a handful of modes which was a nice touch.

Conclusion: While it should in theory be possible to build muscle memory and get good at this game, the investment to reward ratio is dubious at best except for a small niche of super enthusiasts of all things platforming. Since I fall out of this niche by a fair margin I have a fairly strict standard of quality that I expect out of a platformer and this does not nearly passes that. Removing permanently for declutter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042822312', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1531842709}
review:
Hızlı İnceleme

Oyunda 16 bölüm bulunmakta, bunun 8 ini geçtim. Tamamını oynamaya katlanamadım. Bu tarz platformer oyunlarını bedavaya internette browser üzerine oynayabilirsiniz. Hatta ve hatta çok çok daha iyilerini bile oynayabilirsiniz. Oyunun müzikleri dışında bir özelliği olduğunu düşünmüyorum. Alt tab yaptığınızda ve döndüğünüzde oluşan görüntü hataları (ben yaşadım) ve zıplama delayları (birçok arkadaşım yaşamış) gibi problemlerde bulundurmakta. Bu yüzden tam fiyatını veya indirimli bir fiyatı hakettiğini düşünmüyorum. Çok meraklısı varsa indirimde deneyebilir.

"50" yi ortalama kabul edersek puanım "47/100"


İyi oyunlar !

review: LOVE is 2d platformer where you play as an "investigator" and you have to navigate a lot of widely different and bizzare areas. The game mechanics are pretty simple, you can walk, you can jump and you can leave a a spawn point behind at will. What really makes LOVE special is the way it combines somewhat difficult platforming with atmospheric music. Even though the levels would most likely make me rage should they be in other games, in LOVE the music makes each level feel like a unique experience. Personally, I really enjoyed LOVE and to be frank, I feel like I have become a calmer person after playing it.

review: Excellent platformer! Very challenging, but, as stated, very fair. I really like the mechanic of setting your own spawn point. The style and sound are great. Save your progress often! If I could change one thing, I would have this game have support for generic USB gamepads. I have a SNES-style USB gamepad that I'd love to play this with, but had to dig out a 360 gamepad instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282360169', 'num_games_owned': 5695, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1542997760}
review:
[h1]LOVE 是一款还原怀旧像素风格并专注挑战难度的平面跳跃游戏[/h1]
[spoiler]顺便一提同捆包还有一个游戏叫做KUSO，发行商说“KUSO是LOVE的前传”.....[/spoiler]
[i]这游戏来自Indiegala Cyber Revenge Bundle[/i]

[b]操作[/b]
主菜单能开启一段简短的教程，大致就是操作方法，以及跳跃注意事项。
操作方法十分简单，也就只有几个按键，对应着左右移动、跳跃、设置复活点、暂停这几样要素。
每次死亡都会从最近的一个复活点重生，所以要频繁设置复活点免得重生距离太远。

[b]内容[/b]
一共有五种模式：
一般模式、简单模式、一命模式、累计计时模式都是挑战前16关的内容，不同在与复活次数和纯粹的速度挑战而已。
还有一种是特有的复合关REMIX模式，把普通关多个独立出现的危险物结合起来融合制作成的特别关卡。
简单模式真的适合绝大多数的萌新，我也止步在简单模式。

关卡由16个普通关+7个REMIX关+一个马里奥风格的奖励关组成。
每个关卡风格各异，配上富有节奏的BGM，很好平缓了多次死亡的挫败感，实际上有设置复活点这个功能，再试一次的动力也不会轻易失去。


构成平面的要素很少只有三样：纯白色危险物、镂空的白色弹簧、各色的地面。

看到有设置复活点这样的功能，可以预见死亡次数将是相当多的。
作为一个跳跃游戏，跳跃本身太单调，一向来都是通过设置陷阱、障碍物来控制跳跃的难度与过关节奏。
游戏里除了坠落深渊会导致死亡，触碰到纯白色的液体、物体、生物也会导致死亡，纯白色危险物虽然颜色统一，但是十分多样化。
比如可以化成倒刺、雪块、雨滴、巨轮、飞花等等来阻碍小人的前进，当这些危险要素又与难以立足的跳跃空间结合的时候，使得对于跳跃落下的地方需要十分精准地控制，容错率极低导致游戏难度指数上升。

[b]音乐[/b]
多达12首的纯节奏感的BGM，十分适合需要保持跳跃节奏的这款游戏。

[b]结语[/b]
简单流程也不过60分钟的像素风2D跳跃游戏，一段短暂又愉快的[strike]作死[/strike]体验。

author: {'steamid': '76561198044328617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1524335318}
review:
LOVE is a great little platformer for those who like to spend some time polishing their skill in a contained environment, with a contained set of mechanics. You can go through it with infinite lives if you want to, or you can limit your lives to 100 (or 1), or you can try to speed through it - basically defining your preferred criteria for "success". The gameplay feels pretty tight, and while the music is not VVVVVV levels of good, it's still pretty enjoyable. I'll probably come back to it to zone out.

I will also definitely be picking up the sequel, kuso, which I got to try at PAX East. I think that the gamefeel was even better, and the level design was just as clever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002062454', 'num_games_owned': 1484, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1577544389}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024876271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1539653366}
review: Super fluid, pick up and play 8-bit inspired platformer. No enermies. Just jump and see how far you can make it with 100 lives. The controls are tight and the level design is a fantastic example of what can be done with just three colors and a lot of creativity. The soundtrack is fun and keeps you going. My only gripe is that the level music doesn't seamlessly loop, instead you hear a definite begining and end to the song which actually makes it feel a little more repetative than it should otherwise be. I love this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013588423', 'num_games_owned': 1651, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1705617781}

author: {'steamid': '76561198357946023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1518685118}
review:
This game is very uninspired. I came close to not reccomending this game, but I cant do that. This game is not bad, its just not good either. Its the most mediocre game I have played. For only 3 dollars you get  uninspired level design, very weak gameplay mechanics, and only a total of 24 levels, 8 of those being only "kind of" levles. 

Nothing about this game was memorable. The music lasts only 40 seconds or so before a very obvious loop. Levels are easily forgettable, sometimes only lasting 30 seconds. If theres only going to be 16 real levels in the game, you would hope that these levels would be fleshed out and intersting, but no, instead you get super small levels with very shallow gameplay mechanics that rarly get more in depth then just run and jump. The game is just disappointing overall.

This review may come off as very negative, and its not because I disliked the game, but because I see so much potential that wasnt realized in this game. For 3 dollars it can be a fun distraction for a little bit, but dont expect anything all too great here. I wish the best of luck to the developer and I hope this is only a stepping stone to what is to come in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198383848319', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1514490051}
review: I bought it because the description says it includes a level editor, and I anticipated being able to play a ton of different levels in this game's cute, relaxing style. But there's no level editor, and you will beat the included levels in 30 minutes, tops. Get it for $1 and play a few pretty fun levels... Too bad there isn't more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984315222', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1514054440}
review:
[b]Design:[/b]
The Design of the game itself is very retro with some modern touches but afterall very boringly designed. The worst is the level design that leaves you walking and walking without loosing a single life and then out of nowhere, there come passages that make you loose 3, 4, 5 or even 10 lifes in a row.

The whole game just looks and feels like the creator was bored and made a game that should have stayed on theirs and only theirs computer.
[b]4/10[/b]

[b]Music & Audio:[/b]
The songs are, each for their own, pretty nice, but all combined the soundtrack has absolutely no concept at all and the music does not fit to the levels.  
[b]5/10[/b]

[b]Gameplay & Addiction:[/b]
If you are a fan of replaceable plattformers, go for it. It's nice and always g ood for a "goddamnit!"-moment, but if you look for something deep, this isn't your game. I've played plattformers, that where way better concepted than this.
[b]5/10[/b]

[b]Cost-Benefit Equation & resumé:[/b]
Let me be honest, if you really love plattformers, buy it. it's totaly worth the 4 bucks for you then, but if you are not a plattform games lover, you should either get it on discount or not at all.
[b]3/10[/b]

[b]If you like plattformers, this will be a nice time-killer for you, but if you don't, then this game seems like it was purely made for boredness and hunting achievements/trading cards.

The level editor is okay, but... no, just don't buy it.
[i]4.5 / 10[/i][/b]

Additional informations & notes:

- Engine & unsmoothly coded walking make this game unenjoyable
- There is absolutely no story
- Why would anyone buy a soundtrack album DLC for something that has absolutely no concept?

This game really feels like some guy being "hey, I wanna make a game but have absolutely no idea how to, but hey I know how to code."

author: {'steamid': '76561198115381258', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1059, 'last_played': 1660614544}
review: An incredible game in terms of graphics, with that minimalist static made in pixel art, a fairly simple and catchy music at the same time, with some things that can be improved, such as the design of some levels of the game, the order of some levels that balances the difficulty and makes point of difficulty in some levels, more if you want to complete it 100% in its highest difficulty, but in the end a game with a lot of replayability if you like platform games that only have a single mechanic.

review: Short, but everything in it is polished to the finest details. This is the way you use pixel graphics and still remain original, by showing how much you can accomplish while still remaining true to the minimalistic nature of the art. The music is beautiful as well, with many of the tracks being infinitely listenable inside or out of the game. The bonus levels are a sweet feature, and this game is worth every penny you spend on it, I assure you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353248179', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1503837296}
review:
가-볍게 즐기기 좋아요

author: {'steamid': '76561198016826254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1504264618}
review:
Визуально и аудио приятный платформер. Короткий, но разнообразный. Механика игры сделана хорошо. Большинство ачивок получить достаточно просто. Между тобой и идеально пройдённой игрой будет стоять достижение "пройти игру без смертей".

Из минусов можно отметить настраиваемый режим сложности (бесконечные чекпоинты). Все остальное в игре очень хорошо.

8.5 саун треков из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072077591', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1503491731}
review:
+ The art is good and weird.
+ Good level design.
+ Music is ok, ambient electronic tracks.
+ Difficulty is just right, requires very precise jumps and timings sometimes.
+- Kinda short, 16 levels and some extras.
- Minor bug/feature with respawn points in the ice level, it can ruin the run because of a death loop on respawn.

A nice little platforming game to kill some time. If you are into this genre you'll probably enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016747572', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1499146512}
review:
どんなゲーム？：
地面の上で、Sキーを押すことでどこでもセーブできるシンプルなドットアクションゲーム

いいところ：
どこでもセーブでき、回数無制限なのでクリア自体はむずかしくない
マップごとに仕掛けや雰囲気が違って楽しめる
挙動がシンプルで、仕掛けが分かりやすい
縛りプレイ的にはセーブ回数を減らしたり、死亡回数を減らせば
クリア時のスコアもアップするので緊張感が出る

わるいところ：
どこでもセーブできるが、仕掛けの上でセーブすると穴に落ち続けたりする
氷の移動滑車は一定時間後元の場所に戻るので注意

ジャンプ時に大の字になったり、両手を後ろにばたつかせながら走る姿がかわいい

author: {'steamid': '76561198025403989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1498845118}
review:
Carino dai, e nemmeno molto difficile.
Inoltre è molto corto: 16 livelli per la modalità principale che si terminano in pochi minuti.
Poi vi sono anche altre modalità come la prova a tempo (con una classifica mondiale ed una relativa agli amici) ed una modalità remix con meno livelli, presi da quelli della modalità base e leggermente rivisti.
In pratica nel gioco siete un omino che deve raggiungere la fine del livello solo saltando e correndo, evitando gli ostacoli che si incontrano lungo il percorso: gocce di acido che cadono dal soffitto, spuntoni, pozzanghere mortali, proiettili, piattaforme che si muovono sull'abisso ecc...
Si usano due soli tasti: quello del salto ed un altro che permette di sistemare il check point in modo dinamico mentre si prosegue nel livello (utile perchè ad ogni morte si riparte da quest'ultimo. Se non si "creano" i checkpoint si inizia sempre dall'inizio del livello).
I comandi sono molto responsivi e si gioca bene anche con il dpad del controller xbox360.
Lo consiglio? Diciamo di sì, anche se i contenuti sono davvero miseri: in 70 minuti ho terminato il gioco base e la modalità remix. Poi rimangono solo le sfide a tempo, la voglia di scalare le classifiche (che per me personalmente è poca) e magari prendere qualche achievement.
Ora è in sconto a 98 centesimi, direi il prezzo giusto.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198052325988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1574118452}
review: I loved this game. Aestethically very pleasing, with a lot of variety in the levels. Really trippy. Wonderful music. The controls are a bit difficult to get into, but I guess it mimics the feeling of playing on an Arcade? The level design is, in my opinion, amazing. Finishing the main mode requires little time, and just a few tries, but it offers great replay value. Even at full price, it's a great deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009961364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1496629832}
review:
As a fan of platformers, even at $3 this isn't really worth the time. It's a very basic platformer with minimal aesthetics, but rather than building off of that it's more of just no aesthetic. And the one gimmick it does have, setting check points, it's more of a crutch to aid it's dull/tedious level design. 

It's not even that difficult, but for something so simple it makes a few dumb mistakes. A couple of leaps of faith, having a pit right at the start of a stage (when you're already holding right from the previous one), stages where elements are just barely off screen, the fact that white is used to both denote objects that kill you instantly AND ones that are bouncey. It's things that would be more frustrating if the game wasn't so bland that it dulled all emotion.

I want to say that sometimes the levels do feel like they might have something going for them, they employ enough different obstacles/animated visuals that I feel like someone could use some environmental storytelling here if they wanted (it doesn't). Speaking of, not having any map or sense of progression really makes every thing blend together more, and by the time I reach the last stage I was more just "oh, that's it?"

The one real good thing is that some of the tracks sound nice. They aren't out of place I guess, but it's hard not to be fitting when nothing is really going on.

I feel bad for coming off so negative, but this is so basic and minimal, and it doesn't even do that perfectly well. tl;dr this is the tofu to VVVVV's meat, lacking in any and all taste and probably not that filling. Looking forward to forgetting this 1 minute after I post this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007688772', 'num_games_owned': 1260, 'num_reviews': 648, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1496432533}
review:
Platformer ořezaný až na kost. Grafika je nejprimitivnější možná, herní obsah také: běháte a skáčete po plošinkách, vyhýbáte se ostnům a lávě, stejně jako v tisícovce platformerů předtím. Celá hra se dá projít na první dohrání za půl hodiny a na ta další klidně za 15 minut.
Hlavní odlišnost spočívá v možnosti uložit si checkpoint v jakémkoliv místě, pokud stojíte na zemi. To je skvělý nápad, hra by jinak byla ukrutně frustrující, protože cokoliv nebezpečného vás zabije na dotek. Ovládání také není úplně dokonalé a může za to velmi hrubé herní rozlišení. Postava má totiž šířku spodní části pouze tři pixely a plošinky na tom nejsou o moc lépe, přičemž sebemenší pohyb vás vždycky posune o celý pixel. Takže minout plošinku nebo se odrazit na jejím konci je solidně těžké a náročné na přesnost; nakonec se mi nejvíc osvědčilo nejdřív vyskočit a až pak stisknout směr a manévrovat ve vzduchu.
Víc není o čem mluvit. LOVE (význam názvu netuším) umí nabídnout trochu zábavy, ale fakt jen trochu a ne kdovíjaké. I tři eura se mi zdají moc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136015760', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1590242582}
review:
[h1]Скорее Rage, чем Love[/h1]
Ведь в этом платформере есть режим YOLO

Хорошо проработанный платформер, который можно пройти за полчаса, если вы играли в SMB. Несколько режимов, соревновательный дух и азартный настрой заставит вас играть в неё ещё и ещё. [spoiler]Отсутствие второго и/или третьего не способствует [strike]задрачиванию игры[/strike] доведению до идеала[/spoiler]

Можно играть с друзьями по смертям, но это не точно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078679059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1648700128}
review:
We all have those days don't we, you know the one. the ones where you have less then $5 on steam and your trying to figure out what the hell your going do with that dosh. maybe you'll buy that trading card or that pretentious cosmetic for team fortress 2 for your pointless existence that we live in. Begging for the day to die, or you could buy a cheap game you dramatic spazz.

In this pool of games within another smaller pool of games theres 'LOVE' although I don't know how the title fits the game. Probably a self aware joke when you attempt yolo mode where you will love the game [spoiler] after installing the one game on a crappy computer, put it in a field and work for enough money to hire an orbital missle strike [/spoiler]. I wanted something good for a normal afternoon on a 5am while trying to postpone my sleep deprivation and to stop the voices in my head saying that I have a problem, so I blissfuly ignore them to continue my rampaging nihilistic ways. 

[u]gameplay[/u]
You just move, jump and get your way over to the end of the level, avoiding the hazards with what looks like a thing with maths for a head. So what do you want me to say, but lets not get too deep into this review like a poorly implimented sex joke. The level design is not too bad, and it's even better that its properly designed for the controls, albeit sonic 06 ('shruders').

the game does have a 'make your own checkpoint' which is 'so original'. [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lMef2ELINDw]and definetly not made by anyone else[/url] but in summary, the gameplay is adequete and more importantly 'FUN' to play, its nothing new and it knows that so it brings somthing more interesting to gouge your eyes out in a way you like, you creep.

[u]atmosphere[/u]
The games artstye looks like a 40 year old dos user playing mario world on acid. Its actually looks kinda pretty with its basic artstyle and its limited use of pixel art, without using it for the obviouse lazynes. Some of the levels are made to look like a portrait like the part where you go through the bowels of a deformed monster.

The level design always brings something new that differentiates itself. Even the hazards and platforms act differently to help violently stuff the tiny bag of simple controls and gameplay. So the level design is as pretty as its controls well in platforming. Theres even different kinds of music for each platform section you will force the small thing to run through for your sadistic pleasures. Nothing to make you sing until you bash your head against a wall to stop the awesomeness, but nice all together.

[u]conclusion[/u]
The level design and gameplay is good as it needs to be to grab our attention 180 degrees in a violent neck snap. the price is a little steep so you should probably buy it on a 50% sale to starve of your crippling depression for games. 

I have seen better gameplay with simple controls as well and it's called [url=http://www.bornegames.com/games/fpa-world-1/remix/]'fancy pants'[/url]. I'll sum the game up in fifteen words 'it's a free platformer and moving in this game is as good as an orgasim'. Im not saying its a bad game, you should definetly get it on sale if your into platformers. I actually want to see the dude or dudet who is responsible for the creation of this game, and might buy the next game that they release.
