author: {'steamid': '76561198112866114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1504343250}
review:
Who would have thought I out of all people would find 'Love' online?

Granted she may not be the best looking out there, but she makes up for it by just being fun to play with. She also seems to be equally dedicated to the relationship being available 24/7 when ever I need her attention. We seem to have common interests too. We both like music. Our special song being the track of stage 4. I know it might sound silly, but I just lose myself whenever I hear that tune. In fact I constantly fall head over heels for her, often landing on vicious spikes or plummeting endlessly into a depressive chasm, making a fool of myself, but she always picks me up and gets me on my merry way again. 

We've seen some interesting sites together, from the inside of a crocodile, to a sci-fi place with teleporters. We even took screenshots together of our happy travellings especially when I got through a particular site without a spike up my toosh. I've had to battle for her attention at times though, as other suitors have tried to gain her attention by flashing their names on the leaderboard, but with my A++ ranking she treats me as someone special.

Im glad when I found out about this 'Love' and fell instantly gaga for her that I went that extra mile. I approached her owner Fred Wood (https://twitter.com/thatsmytrunks/media) and offered him the bride price of $2.99 which he immediately accepted.

Who said money can't buy you 'Love'?

Below is our honeymoon where I get my A++ ranking...
https://youtu.be/cd7Vb344aE8

author: {'steamid': '76561198126301456', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1475053484}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111654939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1480652404}
review:
It's a very basic but fun platformer to play through.

The only thing that annoys me about this and similar games is that all the achievements are fun, until you get to that one last achievement where you have to beat the entire game without dying once ("yolo mode"). As you can imagine, actually completing the game on yolo mode is ridiculously hard to the point that it would take probably a hundred hours to get there, and it's really frustrating to me that such a mode even exists, because then I sort of want to try it but then have to remind myself how annoying that would be.

Really, that's just me being OCD about wanting to complete games to perfection and I recommend this game anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025889911', 'num_games_owned': 6075, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1586875807}

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197996630152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1483851222}
review:
IF IT'S ON SALE, then you might wanna pick up Love. I got this for about $1, and it's totally worth getting for that price if you want an extremely simple, no-nonsense platformer with spot-on controls. No boring tutorials, no tedious story, just pits and spikes and you jumping carefully over all of them. Being able to manually place checkpoints wherever you want (at the cost of some score) is a great idea too.

However, unless you're really into speedrunning and practicing for flawless playthroughs, you won't be playing this one for long. I beat the main game twice, as well as the Remix Mode, and it all took me less than 45 minutes.

So yeah, a streamlined good time, but it absolutely doesn't last.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261589194', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 304, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1483643575}
review:
게임 이름이 왜 love인지 모르겠다.
생긴 것에 비해 어렵진 않은 난이도.
브금은 참 오묘하게 좋은데, 재미는 더럽게 없다.

하나 꼭 말하고 싶은 것은, 얼음으로 뒤덮힌 스테이지에서 허공에다 저장을 박지 말라는 것.
한 번 떨어지면 허공에서 태어나므로 클리어가 불가능해진다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151059841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1441643217}

review: This is a really good game relies a lot on trial and error and learning from your mistakes. It's not too difficult. The only complaint is that it isn't completely compatible with the steam controller. I can use the controller to jump, move, and kill myself but I can't reset a new spawn point. Until they fix it (if they do), I don't recommend using the Steam controller with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067436645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1502072441}
review:
This game is so good. It's so good. I love it. THE SOUNDTRACK. BUY IT FOR THE SOUNDTRACK ALONE. You can spare three bucks, or one in a steam sale. You cheapskates. I KNOW WHERE YOU GOT YOUR GAMES. AT THE PORTY GABENS USED GAMING STORE.
Seriously, buy it. It only lasts takes an hour or so to beat, but if you're the kind of person who likes to replay certain games until you get inhuman times on them, it'll be more. The gameplay is simple, bordering on 70s Apple II levels of simple (which despite the indie scene's love of pixels, is an under-representated aesthetic). Move, jump, set new respawn. You could port this to any number of early computer system. This creates a pure and direct image jump into the brain. All special platforms whether harmful, bouncy or etc are colored white. No differenciation. The only thing keeping this from being confusing is the fact that their is only a limited amount of different kinds. Otherwise, buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975028311', 'num_games_owned': 1097, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1482528164}
review: What can you expect from a 3 euros game (or now 1.04€ on sale)? Personally I expected rebindable keys, non-r*tarded resolution options, at the very least a master audio slider and responsible controls. None of which was presend in LOVE. What I got instead was brutal screen tearing in full screen, a control scheme that's not ideal for qwertz layout and input lag both on keyboard and the Steam Controller (that didn't work correctly out of the box btw). This is why  you shouldn't buy too cheap games...

author: {'steamid': '76561197995383331', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1547360804}
review:
[h1] Cuando Menos es más[/h1] 

 Love es un juego de plataformas a la antigua, el objetivo principal será correr, saltar y llegar al final del nivel; sin embargo la mezcla idónea entre elementos “retro” y elementos nuevos hacen de este juego una experiencia memorable, como un cóctel entre lo viejo y lo nuevo que da como resultado un juego nostálgico, bello e innovador.

[b] Gráficas: [/b] 

Sus gráficas apuestan por una estructura simple. El personaje recuerda a un muñeco de palotes. Los caminos y obstáculos son minimalistas. Si bien, el ladrillo de este apartado visual es el pixel, pocos colores y poco realismo, nos encontramos ante un aspecto visual de una belleza innegable. Usando pocos elementos presenciamos un mundo completo capaz de evocar distintas emociones.
En algunos niveles se muestran lugares muy precisos, por ejemplo en el nivel 5 se dibuja una fábrica abandonada y en el nivel 11 se introduce lo que parece un gran animal. En su mayoría los niveles son caminos abstractos de representación simple pero contundente. La magia de las gráficas en Love es que con pocos colores y formas precisas se construyen recorridos con personalidad.

[b] Música:  [/b] 

Este mundo no estaría completo sin la música que se ha seleccionado para ambientar cada nivel pues este es uno de los aspectos donde es más contundente la mezcla retro-nuevo. Las melodías y sus instrumentos refuerzan la construcción de cada uno de estos espacios, llevan a sentir en el jugador incertidumbre, misterio, melancolía o perplejidad. Son canciones vertiginosas, lentas, rítmicas o cadentes capaces de proporcionar no solo fuerza a cada espacio sino variedad y frescura.

[b] Mecánicas y Contenido: [/b] 

Uno de los aspectos más interesantes del juego son las mecánicas que propone. Aunque es un juego de plataformas en toda usanza. Está condimentada con elementos que hacen que el juego sea más flexible y divertido en comparación con clásicos del género.
El contenido principal del juego son 16 niveles. Los diferentes modos hacen que el juego sea amigable para jugadores novatos; y retador para aquellos que gusten de una dificultad alta.
Modo Arcade tenemos las reglas básicas: jugar por los 16 niveles con 100 vidas. Modo Fácil podemos hacer el recorrido con una cantidad ilimitada de vidas. “Yolo Mode”, que podría considerarse el ultra difícil, solo con una vida. “Runner” en el cual el reto será  lograr el menor tiempo posible y por último el “Mix” donde nos encontramos con 8 pantallas nuevas en donde se usan los mismos elementos usados previamente más unos pocos aspectos nuevos.
La mecánica que hace a este recorrido flexible y fresco es la forma en cómo se pueden establecer los “puntos de chequeo” (checkpoint). A diferencia de la mayoría de los juegos de plataformas clásicos en donde nos encontramos en un punto de chequeo a mitad de cada nivel, en Love es posible establecer un punto de chequeo en casi cualquier parte del juego. Cada vez que mueres revives en el punto que has elegido y no estás obligado a empezar desde el principio del nivel, aunque en el modo “Yolo” no es posible usar los puntos de chequeo pues acá estamos “solos contra el mundo” esta opción está disponible en todos los demás modos.  
Esta posibilidad está matizada por otro aspecto del juego, una “calificación” que medirá tu desempeño tomando diferentes variables: tiempo, número de vidas, o puntos de chequeo usados. Un consejo útil para obtener más puntos: entre menos uses puntos de chequeo, más puntaje recibirás.
La mecánica antes nombrada también ve complementada por la opción de suicidarse para volver al punto de chequeo. Aunque parece extraño, la cuestión es que en ocasiones uno puede caer y retroceder en el recorrido, se puede elegir morir y volver al punto de chequeo de manera instantánea en lugar de repetir lo ya recorrido, se sacrifica una vida para ahorrar tiempo o evadir la tarea de volver a hacer lo ya hecho. Como cuando sacrificas tus brazos para llevar todas las bolsas en un solo viaje al regresar del supermercado.

[b] Consideraciones Finales: [/b] 

Por último es importante resaltar el hecho de que el juego está lleno de pequeños detalles que suman en toda su experiencia. Cuando el personaje muere la animación de la muerte y el sonido cambian, por ejemplo puede ser una explosión, o el dibujo de un “ángel que se desvanece”. Otro detalle se da cuando nos encontramos con pequeños trampolines que hacen las veces de camas elásticas o plataformas móviles que se desplazan según en la dirección que camines sobre ellas, pequeños aspectos que enriquecen y dan personalidad al juego.

[b] Conclusión: [/b] 

Love es un juego corto, se puede superar el modo arcade en aproximadamente 6 horas. Intentar  conseguir la mejor calificación, con los modos “Yolo” o “Runer” son formas de agregar más tiempo de diversión y vida útil al juego. Además de todos los aspectos interesantes que nos presenta, Love tiene un precio bastante asequible lo que lo hace un  juego muy recomendable.

[b] Puntuaciones: [/b] 
Gráficos: 7
Sonido: 10
Mecánicas: 8
Promedio: 8.3

author: {'steamid': '76561198065346433', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1474637264}
review:
非常感谢送我这款游戏的好友ENGAGED DANCEHALL。
游戏关卡不多，总共只有24关，16主要关卡，7关remix关卡和1关马里奥彩蛋关。
游戏玩法也只是躲刺儿和陷阱，只有在第16关会出现子弹(在马里奥彩蛋关有怪)
总共5个模式，不过都大同小异，只是有了生命限制和时间设定，remix mode则是躲加了7个关卡。
如果你玩easy mode的话一小时左右就能通关所有关卡
没有剧情讲述，也许作者是想通过场景来表达剧情，但我并不能看懂，我只能看出了在第11关主角进入了一条虫(龙)的身体里然后顶破了什么东西，然后又逃了出来...接着就到了一个类似机器区域的地方...
标题虽然叫love，但是游戏内容跟love挂不上一点关系，也许是想表达主角为了LOVE通过重重困境拯救了公主？
或者将这款游戏送给他人可以增加LOVE值(笑)

如果你喜欢超级食肉男孩或者i wanna系列游戏的话，不妨试试这一款，虽然这游戏的难度不比前面的那两款要高，但是也不低。

author: {'steamid': '76561198284231396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1474569452}
review:
I bought this game for 65p and for 65p. Damn i enjoyed it. Nice little precision platformer with varied levels and a nice rage feeling when you get punted all the way back for faltering even slightly on a level. 

HOWEVER.

If i had to be nit picky, the arcade "lives" system is a bit outdated and the ability to save between play throughs would have been nice...

ESPECIALLY SINCE...

This game honestly gave me motion sickness...the way the camera works is a little sickening and can really throw you off your game. So not being able to save and come back to your run...Yeah that sucks a little. 

BUT

For 65p. Yes. Yes. Yes. Yes. 

Money finally bought love and she abused me again and again...and again and again i forgave her and...yeah its 65p/£1.99 just play the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127268597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1584711202}
review:
[h1]LOVE [9/10][/h1]

[u]Mais c'est quoi LOVE ?[/u]

Alors, non LOVE n'est pas hélas un jeu qui t'aimera :(. C'est plutôt vous qui allez l'aimer.
LOVE est un petit jeu de plateforme qui vous garantira rage et amusement. En effet, vous incarnez un petit personnage qui va gravir les échelons pour arriver finalement au niveau 16. 
En tryhardant un peu, vous remarquerez des passages 'cachés' sur certains niveaux mais, il faut vraiment le savoir. 
Pour ce qu'il en est des succès ils ne sont pas tellement faciles à avoir, je dis pas ça pour le succès "YOLO" où tu n'as qu'une vie évidemment, succès que je tryhard depuis un CERTAIN TEMPS LUI AUSSI MAIS QUI N'ARRIVE PAS CAR IL Y A DES PIQUES PARTOUT. Hum, excusez-moi je m'emporte. 

[u]Points positifs[/u]
[list]
    [*]Je suis forte à ce jeu. (Soyez logique si j'y arrive, vous aussi.)
    [*]Le jeu n'est pas cher 2.99e 
    [*]Un jeu addictif.
    [*]Beaucoup de niveaux, donc de variétés. Il compte 16niveaux dans le mode normal, des niveaux remix, et un niveau 'Mario' avec de petites tortues trop mignonnes. ♥ 
   
[/list]
[u]Points négatifs [/u]

[list]
    [*]LA MUSIQUE ME STRESS!
    [*]C'est rageant. (Bon c'est logique sur ce genre de jeux bien sûr.)
    [*]Les succès ne sont pas si évident à avoir. (YOLO) 
[/list]


	[b]Jeu fortement conseillé si vous aimez les jeux de plateforme. 	[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198082224516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1608991188}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036064556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1471298077}
review:
I'm going to be honest. I bought the game because I heard a great song in the trailer. I now have the song in an online playlist of music. I don't have the game anymore. 

The game is locked at 30 fps and it honestly makes me sick during some sections. VVVVVV did fine since the screen never scrolls and the only thing that moves is the character, but the whole screen moves in LOVE and it looks and feels terrible.

Also, the reason I bought the game was mainly to listen to music like the one in the trailer. Turns out the rest of the music is nothing like the one in the trailer. Every time you beat a level, the music abruptly stops and switches to another song instead of fading into the next one. 

One irksome thing that this game makes you do is set your own checkpoints. In VVVVVV there were checkpoints everywhere. Every time you did a jump or challenge, there was a checkpoint standing there waiting for you to save your progress. In this game, you "get" to set it yourself. This could make the game easier in some cases. However, it was mainly a bother to me. At some points I'd make tremendous progress throughout the level. Then I'd die, feel a slow sinking in my stomach as I remember that I hadn't saved my progress at all and am promptly respawned at my last checkpoint way, way back in the level. Leaving the checkpoints to be set by the player and not designing them around the levels seems like lazy development to me.

It wouldn't be a huge problem if you could set the checkpoints [i]in addition to[/i] the checkpoints that are already there, but it's a mechanic that just sucks.

I had to refund the game because the reasons above made the game incredibly unenjoyable for me. I played it and beat it twice as well as playing all the extra levels in search of the fun I so wanted to have in the game, but I just couldn't enjoy it because the music was bad, the fps was too low, the checkpoint system was a pain. Controlling the character also felt less responsive than VVVVVV, but that could be a combination of the 30 fps and the whole screen moving at the same time.

I don't recommend buying this game, but you should definitely check out the song from the trailer. https://youtu.be/_kh42huPe78

author: {'steamid': '76561198049362156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1471137321}
review:
The biggest flaw I hit in this game: it's possible to make the game unwinnable by placing a respawn point on one of the moving platforms on that "snow" level such that the vehicle then respawns in its default position and the respawn point is left floating in mid-air, and you are repeatedly dropped in the instant-kill snow.  I also kind of would have liked if there was some way to ask the game "what level number is this?".

Contrasted with VVVVVV's patented "ice-level style" slippery controls, which (a) are just mean, (b) are confirmed intentional and (c) [presumably] follow you through all of VVVVVV, LOVE comes out as a definite "CHALLENGING BUT FAIR".

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11196, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1470731044}
review:
Hate would probably be a better name.

The game was released in 2014 and it looks marginally better than what you would see on an Atari 2600.    Extremely low effort graphics.   "Retro aesthetic" is advertising speak for "terrible developer has no skill and couldn't afford an artist". 

Gameplay is annoying simply because it was designed for consoles and advises the use of a gamepad, as if you're some kind of console peasant. 

Developers who treat PC gamers like peasants and then show up on Steam asking for PC gamers to give them money for their low effort retro junk deserve thumbs down. 

There's no "participation awards" in Steam reviews.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088958794', 'num_games_owned': 1410, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1522345929}
review:
Love is short but enjoyable. For a precision platformer the controls feel tight and accurate and you will be sure that everytime you die it is because of a mistake you made.The game is not overly hard and you are able to put down an unlimited amount of checkpoints at your own will during most game modes. The game is short only around 15-20 minutes for a normal playthrough but the game is built around speed running making you want to play it over and over to try and beat your last time. Their are other modes such as YOLO mode which can add to the challenge if you feel like you have mastered the game. The game has a classic Atari look to it and the level design is well done and each level looks and feels unique. Overall the game is good for its duration, the replayability is good, Graphics are awesome and its only $3.

Game Showcase/Gameplay-

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tJjye6xNEW4

author: {'steamid': '76561198159301345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1584886348}
review:
LOVE is a cool retro-styled platform game with minimalistic graphics, controls and music; you have to get from a side of the screen to another avoiding any white-colored objects and/or pits, you can only move and jump but the level design is good and the stages manage to feel really different from eachother even with the limited amount of actions (said levels,in most cases, are incredibly good looking sometimes,even if they are fullymade of simple monochromatic pixels...).
Another great element of the game is the soundtrack, always entartaining and fit for guiding you trough the various stages. The game isn't that hard not long so it can be completed in around 1-2 hours, however extra modes (like a time challenge or no-death mode) can make it pretty long and hard to beat if you are looking to 100% it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984793828', 'num_games_owned': 2063, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1467891558}
review:
I liked it. I liked it a lot more than I expected I would !

It's really hard not to think of VVVVVV if you've played it. Lots of similarities for sure, and I'm suspecting a huge difference in previous gamedev experience between the two. Doesn really matter. Love has less exploration - straight up levels in a linear path. Classic platforming instead of the inverting gravity mechanic. The unlimited-save-point is really neat, I probably would not have finished it otherwise. I'm not a fan of ultra punishing platformers, so that made it decent - deal with one thing at a time and don't go back all the way to the beginning if you fail. I did trap myself in a sucky place with a  savepoint once -- do not use them on the platforms in the ice cavern after they've moved..

Special note on the soundtrack - really excellent! First time I'm thinking about actually buying the tracks if they don't come with the game out of the box.

I'm not into speedruns or leaderboards so unless I see an update with new levels replayability will be very low for me. But I still enjoyed it while it lasted (it IS rather short). As usual if youthink that just much $ for the lenght just wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037157856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1467420012}
review:
Well, this game was hard but I had a blast going through all the obstacles and finally completing it. Just so you all know, you're going to die. And you're going to die lots. You'll need to be dexterous and very precise. The graphics reminded me of old Spectrum games minus the annoying colour clash of yesteryear. That's a good thing. The music is groovy too. 

I completed this within four hours. The game might be short, but you got to complete it in one sitting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153540405', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1674314433}
review:
Тааааак, что тут у нас? обзор на Русском языке? :))
Ок, начну. Не буду заморачиваться с изменением текста.

Мне понравилось:
 *Стоимость: 30р по скидке.
 *МУЗЫКААА
 *Интересный геймплей: много режимов игры. Начиная от standart и заканчивая yolo mode, где у тебя 1хп...
 *Различие уровней: все уровни отличаются колоссально. Только цвет может совпадать с предыдущим.
 *Хардкорность/крутое решение: на клавишу "Х" ты сам ставишь чекпоинт. НО! Будьте аккуратны, его можно поставить в ловушке и все, гг.
 *Графика, хть она и пиксельная, но анимация и качество картинки радует глаз)

Из минусов только одно:
На клавишу "Enter" - меню, а на клавишу "Пробел" - "Ок"
И это никак не поменять...
Ой, ладно, не буду придираться, крутая игра, прикольно пройти так всю до конца, а потом еще раз, и еще, и еще. (В разных режимах канеш)
Берите и катайте

author: {'steamid': '76561198062001132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1465679003}
review:
Okay, first off I very much enjoyed this game. Though I'm not entirely sure about "a focus on a challenging difficulty", the controls were wonderfully consistent and responsive, which I imagine is exactly what you want out of a precision platformer. I never once had a death in this game that I could blame on anything but myself. And that's how it should be, really.

I'm far from an expert on precison platforming, but that feeling of actually being in control is exactly what I'd want out of a skill-based game. The simplicity of the gameplay helps a lot, of course.

Very short, and though the level editor does help, a better level creation interface and/or Steam Workshop support would be nice. However, a game that's short and to the point and doesn't overstay its welcome is better than a long game that gets really redundant and boring after a while.

+very responsive controls
+purely skill-based, no impossible timing or luck or [i]unreasonably[/i] precise jumps
+reasonable length
+level creation feature (not really a level editor, exactly, you just need to edit a collection of gifs to make a level)
+nice soundtrack

-could have used additional more difficult levels
-visual style is a bit inconsistent (especially the weird backgrouns in the later levels), and "retro" has been done to death
-no Steam Workshop support

(Bought this game on a sale for two bucks, but all in all I'd say it could be worth three.)

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198081363166', 'num_games_owned': 1268, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1695841839}
review:
[h1]LOVE is...[/h1]

[i]Восьмибитный хардкорный платформер, способный довести игрока до нервного срыва. Я крайне не советую играть в нее в Arcade-режиме, посколько после этого Вы сильно рискуете попасть в ближайший санаторий на неопределенный срок.
Из преимуществ игры я бы выделила изумительное [b]музыкальное сопровождение[/b], напоминающее помесь диско и электроники из 80-ых. Я бы не рекомендовала играть в [b]LOVE[/b] в наушниках, поскольку музыка здесь намертво въедается в мозг и отвлекает от прохождения. 
[b]Теперь о пикселях.[/b] Здесь я бы также добавила некий дисклеймер, поскольку изредка игра выдает крайне неприятные сюрреалистические "сюрпризы", способные довести игрока до эпилептической эйфории.
[b]Управление[/b] в игре довольно стандартное и комфортное для жанра платформеров. Присутствует возможность создания точек сохранения - нужно всего-то нажать клавишу "X". Никогда не забывайте об этом, поскольку именно эта 4ертова кнопка (да, я не знала о ней!) позволит Вам пройти игру до конца.

[b]Вердикт:[/b] В полку хардкорных платформеров прибыло! Покупать не рекомендую только в случае, если Вас мутит от одного вида минималистической восьмибитной графики. Всем остальным покупать на свой страх и риск.

[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/alina_nomie/recommended/246420]➤ Ссылочка на предыдущий обзор ❣[/url]

А ежели Вам понравились данные обзоры, то смело подписывайтесь на мое курирование игр на соответствующей [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/30845640]странице[/url] в Steam Store. Также вступайте в [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/nomie]группу ♥ Nomie Games ♥[/url], полностью посвященную моим игровым обзорам.[/i]

review:
It is a VERY good game. It is very cheap (I got it on a deal), so the price is good for this game! The game's music is super awesome, there are 14 levels, plus remixes and a level editor (which is a little bizarre), and the satisfaction of getting an A++ rank is great. The game is challenging, especially if you are an achievement hunter. You should really give it a go, have it be the music or the fun platforming, just try it. :)

I LOVE It. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038121919', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1485546106}
review:
Short and sweet. Took me a few months to get round to completing it though because I ragequit when I first played it. It was at that level with the disappearing platforms you have to make your way across before you jump down some lasers. I was just terrible at the timing.

...and then I screwed myself over the second time I played at that level with the platforms you run on and they move for you (its an ice-themed level). I set a respawn point where the platforms don't spawn and died there... then the platform went back to its spawn point and I proceeded to spawn and die endlessly. And that level is right near the end of the game too, so I had to play pretty much all the levels again.

Well, I finally beat it the third time round.

The soundtrack is good. And very weird. I think that suits the game though.

There are also some remixed levels of varying difficulty (which I beat without too much trouble after playing through the campaign levels), and extra challenging modes for those who want some replayability such as speedrun and 1-life-only mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131141996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1429289356}
review:
На мой взгляд она из лучших игр в жанре платформер. Наверно потому что единственный платформер, в который играл на компе :D
Если серьезно - игра очень понравилась из за 3 вещей:
1) Хорошо проработанное управление.  Играть персом действительно удобно. 
2) Графика на уровне просто. Даже если взять в расчет то, что она "пиксельная" - это не помешало ей быть очень интересной, разнообразной и необычной. Карта с внутренностями животного особенно крута, ;)
3) Музыкальное сопровождение. Выше всяких похвал.
----
Как итог - цена полностью себя оправдывает. А взяв по скидке за 5 рублей - так и вовсе дар)
P.S. Любите платформеры - она для вас!

author: {'steamid': '76561198136247140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1467601391}
review:
흔한 가시피하기 게임으로 현재는 영상에 나오는 것과 비슷한 길이의 스테이지 16개로 구성되어있습니다.
가끔가다 패치로 스테이지를 늘려주는 것 같습니다.
할인을 한다면 딱 가성비 하는 게임으로 죽고 첫 스테이지부터 다시 시작하기를 한 두시간정도 반복하시면
16스테이지까지 무난히 클리어하며 이경우 끝까지 달리는데에는 저주받은 손 기준 20분 정도 소요되는 것 같네요.

OST도 좋고 그냥저냥 분위기를 즐기기에도 나쁘지 않으며 끝까지 한 번 깨고 지겨워져도
친구들을 불러다 놓고 시켜주며 고통받는 모습을 즐기시면 되기에 추천하나 박고 갑니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049105851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1458523797}
review:
I'm going against recommending LOVE, despite the fact that I did enjoy it. For one, I can appreciate any 2D platformer that has the decency to give you a "save anywhere" feature. Mario and Metroid, while fun can be very tiring after playing the same part of a level over and over and LOVE totally cuts that out. I love it. Thank you.

However, there isn't a whole lot to recommend beyond the save-anywhere feature. You run and jump. You avoid obstacles in well-designed levels. And that's it. Granted, there are changes to gameplay and obstacles but they're so short that you don't get a feeling of actually mastering them, like in Mario or Metroid.

That and the fact that the game has 16 levels (well, technically a lot more with the remix mode), despite the changes in speedrun mode and hard mode... there isn't much to LOVE to really find anything special in. Similar to "You Have to Win the Game", LOVE does has smooth controls, a nice graphical aesthetic, and a great difficulty and save feature, but it's so samey and safe that it's just not something you'll want to go back and play in a while. Or at least I don't.

If you like a fun 2D Platformer, LOVE certainly is that. But beyond the simple mechanics, it's not a particularly memorable experience. I'm giving it a 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120455756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1629332710}
review: The game dosen't literally mean it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034306697', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 617, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1458124585}
review:
A very short & somewhat difficult pick-up-and-play platformer. Use of both a keyboard and a controller are very manageable so choosing one would be just up to preference I think in this case.
The base game consists of around 16 levels and it takes around 20 to 30 minutes to finish the regular mode (Arcade mode) without completely losing all of your given lives in a playthrough. There are several other modes available for those competitive completionist schmucks such as a one-life mode and a speedrun mode.

Not a whole lot to the game. For $2.99 full price it ain't too bad for what it's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063540483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1705996169}
review:
Simple, se nota el empeño puesto en él, así como en la música. Para ser un juego de plataformas es un deleite a la vista y jugarlo siempre es agradable (todo por el intento de sacar el logro "yolo" por mi parte). 
Pero no obstante, si bien tiene más de una modalidad de juego, hay que tener en cuenta que los niveles siempre son los mismos. En lo personal, YO NO DUDARIA EN COMPRARLO DE NUEVO.
Si buscas pasar el rato, un buen juego de plataformas al estilo clásico, Buena ambientación al estilo 8-Bits, y que a la vez tenga una increíble banda sonora (a lo que da el estilo arcadia); Este juego te sorprenderá!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994252834', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1457740770}
review:
TL;DR version: Good game, good music, get it.

chatterboxy version:

I played this game before it came to Steam. A lot has changed since then. Some changes were small, some were big. 

I recommend this game. Controls are great and responsive, I dig the music, levels are creative. Is it worth a full price? I think so, but a tiny decrease of price wouldn't hurt, but that's what sales are for. 

And ask yourself this." What is LOVE to you? Will you rush  it, ready to risk everything, or will you take your time and go slowly? Will you keep going despite the loses, Or will you give up after first failure. " That line was based on how the original description of the game presented the game. It's not exact quote, but the feeling was similar. They could bring it back, but i digress.

----------------

The only problem is that it very simple and the only noticeable difference is the ability to apply respawns where you want, the rest is only a trial and error game. I recommend only for true platform game fans (and simplistic) and yet, only a good sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038036264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1455321291}
review:
Much of what this game is and how it plays can be gathered from the video and screenshots on its store page, so I won't bore anyone with too much exposition. Simple platforming.

This is exactly how LOVE shines. Despite garnering somewhat of a reputation for being difficult, it is fair and surprisingly humble. There are no nasty tricks in any of the levels; what you see and anticipate is what you get. The game is minimalistic in its pixel appearance, but quickly apparent that it's not in any cliché sense of retro appeal. It is a subtly stylish game that excels in presenting simple, clean platforming concepts through bite-sized, themed levels. LOVE is even confident enough in its design to allow for manual checkpoint placement in every level, and it works. I have to add that the soundtrack is also pretty fantastic, and helps LOVE maintain a fascinating, enigmatic atmosphere alongside the deliberately minimal visuals.

LOVE is short yet succinct, and a great deal for the price it asks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189755819', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1705678414}
review:
1.游戏操作
这款游戏的跳跃机制有些特别，按下跳跃键的时间会决定不同的跳跃高度（不是蓄力跳），而且就算是碰上天花板，只要还按着跳跃键，浮空效果也是能实现的
重设出生点的机制还可以暴力地通过某些关卡，不会因为觉得手残放弃游戏
2.可重复性
虽然只有短短（并不）16个关卡，加上困难点的remix也才24个，但是你会想如何在更短的时间、更少的死亡次数内通关
再加上五种模式可以选择（100条命，无限生命，1命，计时，remix），所以还是很耐玩的
3.游戏音乐
就是冲着trailer的音乐买的！第一款想要买音轨的游戏啊！
4.可能卡关的地方
1）在有一条传送带传送弹跳台的关卡，走下面我是还没成功，走上面方便点
2）貌似龙的身体的那一关，看trailer有一段，就是要顶那个圆圆的白色物体，然后往回走
3）传送门那一关，最后要用重设出生点过
4）最后一关躲弹幕的话……实在不行就各种强行重设出生点吧……

review: I dig this game's art style, I enjoyed the music, and I like the price, but I can't recommend it. This frustrating game requires perfect play. It gives you lots of control over your checkpoints, and gives you lots of lives, but then takes those lives with leaps of faith into instant death and has huge sections where you can't use checkpoints. Ameliorating difficulty only counts is that amelioration is effective and the difficulty is fair. No dice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995267601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1454730733}
review:
I'll just start by saying that you really shouldn't go for all achievements unless you have a *lot* of patience. A lot. YOLO mode (I hate writing that...) will just infuriate you when you hit a spike or other white obstacle. Ow.

I guess LOVE does hurt.

Anyway, this is a very simple platformer with a neat style of very low res monochromatic graphics and a small but pleasant and varied soundtrack. All you do is run and jump, nothing more, through 16 levels with a few gimmicks, not too many.  Tight controls (I can only blame mistakes on myself or having a hard time with an analogue controller sometimes). Has custom levels if you're into making stuff or modding, though I do wish there was accompanying Workshop support.

I wouldn't say I LOVE it, but it's good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996627259', 'num_games_owned': 1878, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1454024347}
review:
Love is a simple platforming game where you get 100 lives and set your own checkpoints while travelling through 16 different levels. The concept is fine, but it's very flawed when it comes to it's execution.

The look of the game follows this simple aesthetic, and looks a bit like something that would have come out on the Intellivision. However, they don't take the aesthetic far enough so the graphics manage to look more boring and cheaply made instead of retro.

The soundtrack is good, and is likely the best part of the game. However, it's not super mindblowing or anything, just well done.

The part where this game really breaks apart for me is in the level design and the controls. The levels are all really simply designed, with the paths you take through them being really basic without much of anything interesting going on, sometimes simply having them be an excuse to shove some poorly drawn pixel art in your face. All of the levels essentially feel very uninspired.
The controls are really imprecise and don't feel as tight and resonsive as something like a Super Meat Boy or even a VVVVVV. Your jump doesn't really have any weight to it, either. Your character doesn't feel weighty or floaty, there's essentially just no inertia to any of the movement. It just feels like it's moving your character up as you hold the jump button and immediately moving them down as you let go. The controls just feel [b]BAD[/b] and are probably the worst part of the game.

Overall, it's a simple game, and while it's inexpensive, it's also not a great experience. If you're looking for a simple, retro platformer, you could do much better, for not much more money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025601396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1602709092}
review:
If you like retro platforming and short little games, you'll enjoy love.

Pros:
- Very good controls, though the jumping can feel a little floaty until you get used to it
- About the right length
- The Set Respawn Point mechanic, which allows you to set a respawn point anywhere in the level at the cost of some end-of-game points is an interesting way to make the game more challenging the better you get at it--the better you are, the less respawns you use
- Nice soundtrack

Cons:
- I like the game's length but it can be run through in less than an hour the first time if you have any platforming experience. Of course, the real fun is going through it and trying to better your score, so YMMV
- There is one level where it's possible to set a respawn point and make the game unwinnable. It's very close to the end of the game, so that can be frustrating.

Otherwise, I've had a lot of fun with LOVE. The price is right.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096902741', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1482045661}
review: Retro platforming done right. Very short and cheap, and easily worth your time. A lot of room for completionists, as well (Trying to finish faster, with less deaths, etc)

author: {'steamid': '76561198112808984', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1537419469}
review:
Summary: LOVE isn't a bad game exactly, but it's very far from a great one. Mediocre in a lot of ways, LOVE fails to ever exceed expectations, nor does it ever fail to meet them. It's the epitome of generic, and while it is decent, that isn't enough to qualify as a recommendation. LOVE is never great; it's just passable. 

LOVE unfortunately possesses flaws that so many other 8-bit indie platformers have been hampered by. LOVE doesn't really feel like an entirely complete package either, which is a damn shame, because there's obviously a lot of effort and care that's been put into this product. However, it is basically just your run of the mill 8-bit indie platformer. I wouldn't say you shouldn't purchase this, because that's not my decision. Perhaps you will the find the enjoyment in this title that I didn't.

Pros: -Tight controls 

-Genuinely intense gameplay at times

-Good soundtrack 

-Fair amount of replayability and modes 

-Cheap and fair price 

-Level editor

Cons: -Too short, can be completed in 30 minutes or less 

-Generic in many ways 

-Visuals hard to look at after a while 

-Feels somewhat incomplete 

-Aesthetic feels somewhat unneeded, doesn’t really add or take away from the game 

Full review here: https://theflashcollection.wordpress.com/2016/01/21/love-review-2/

author: {'steamid': '76561198072055752', 'num_games_owned': 3062, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1516573536}
review:
When a game is rather short and doesn't have a story, an endboss or any RPG aspects to make your character stronger the more you play, WHY would anyone repeatedly play it after their first play-through?

Because you realize that it is carefully designed in a way that, instead of getting bored or frustrated or annoyed, you quickly get better at it with every try and that's alot of fun, THAT'S WHY. There is no randomness, the game world stays the same with every run, but YOU make all the difference. 

The game manages to incite eagerness to see how far you can beat your previous score, or reach the C, B or even A++ grade in the final summary screen, or climb through the ranks of the leaderboard, or beat the 12-minute speedrun achievement. This game is about your playing through the game, and it doesn't try to be about anything else, and from that perspective the minimalism of the game's presentation is completely appropriate and even helpful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028049202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1474125081}
review:
I enjoyed this game a lot, because I got exactly what I expected.
It's a cheap, simple, short, stylish platformer. 

It takes around 20-30 minutes to beat, but there's replayability in the form of highscores: Die less and finish it faster.
The difficulty is nice. It's hard at first, but you quickly get familiar with the levels and it becomes easy enough so that beating it without dying starts looking reasonable.

If you want a quick platformer, go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253761429', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1451424209}
review: A good, short game. It's what you get for the price you pay. I'd certainly recommend it to someone who enjoys setting records and speed runs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056236289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1456532160}
review: I feel like this would be a really good platformer for people who want to get into hardcore platforming. This game isn't about winning, it's about getting better. It allows you to place checkpoints infinitely and replay any level from the menu. The controls are a little floaty and the game is really short. However it is totally worth the money and is very very replayable. Plus has my favorite soundtrack in gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994397124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1426022715}
review:
Fun little platformer, with mostly accuracy-based gameplay.
As you can see, the graphics are extremely minimalistics -pixel art with HUUUGE pixels-, but the music do make up for it (https://loveplus.bandcamp.com/album/love-ost), also like in some old games, there are no SFX here.

Very short (less than 1h) but the low price should make up for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034799250', 'num_games_owned': 815, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1465624775}
review:
To be completely honest, bought this because i found the name fitting with my (old) username.

Turned out i got a very tight and solid platformer with nice visuals and a great soundtrack. Since the game is fairly short and every run goes through the same levels in the same order with the same obstacles, this is an excellent game for speedruns and competitions, even giving you a dedicated Speedrun mode.

This game may be easy to learn to play, but it's quite tricky to master. You especially need timing, precision and patience if you wanna get through without dying all too much. Considering you are not playing YOLO mode (you only have one life throughout the entire run), you can however put a checkpoint at all times except when you are in the air or bouncing. But placing fewer checkpoints also increases your end score, same goes with dying.

I was actually really damn suprised what a fun game this actually is, especially for that price you get a pretty good deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994729181', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1448994941}
review:
Pros:
 - Platforming works fine
 - Cheap
 - Music sounds good

Cons:
 - Checkpoint system is lazy and can literally ruin a run
 - Short
 - Music comes as a second paid purchase
 - Doesn't really innovate

There's not enough content, nor enough innovation, to warrant the purchase. Go play VVVVVV again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103858151', 'num_games_owned': 1758, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1466390084}
review:
Pure platform di stampo arcade dove la sfida è sostanzialmente basata sul battere se stesso. Il level design ricorda molto quello delle fasi squisitamente platform dei vecchi MegaMan per NES, con spuntoni, burroni o altri ostacoli che ti oneshottano e piattaforme che si materializzano ad intermittenza. Godevole grazie a una soundtrack particolare dato lo stile minimalista, mi sarei aspettato la solita chiptunata ignorante sinceramente.
Divertente per una sessione lampo ma non oltre sinceramente, ma dato il prezzo e la facile reperibilità in bundle vari gli si può dare un pollice su.

PS. Ringrazio il boss per avermi regalato la key

However, if you can pick this up on sale for cheap (like I did in part of a $2 bundle) then I'd highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031573631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1447621344}
review:
LOVE is a title that excels at being great by being excellently simple.

At first glance, LOVE seems to be another run-of-the-mill Indie platformer
that uses crisp, precise controls as a sole reason to pick it up.

And yes, the game plays absolutely great. Every mistake, every death, every 
flow disturbing moment that you might come across while playing through this very 
brief experience (a buddy of mine beat this game in a little less than 1 hour) is 
entirely at the fault of the player.

Like other successful Platformers of days gone past (Super Mario, Mega Man, Contra,
SotN), this title experience the bliss of controls that respond perfectly to your every wish.

LOVE: "Wanna jump? Sure, bruh."

LOVE: "Wanna jump a little bit farther? Be careful, but go ahead, my man."

LOVE: "Wanna risk that jump every though you're thinking in the back of your head that 
you might not make it? By all means, but it's all you when you lose another life."

This game has too much to offer for me to sum up in a few paragraphs (partly because I love 
to write about things that I come to cherish).

But if you want a quick, fair-in-it's difficulty game with an atmospheric mystery, wonderful,
catchy soundtrack, and a depth that betrays whatever you've been told about it in the past,
pick this up fo sho.

And for just $5 (or less if it's on sale), what's there not to LOVE?

author: {'steamid': '76561198142437572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1531285497}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025983093', 'num_games_owned': 988, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1439134679}

author: {'steamid': '76561198089808499', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1479774129}
review:
Love is a short, but very fun indie platformer. There is no story. It's just pure platforming.

[u]The game has five different modes[/u]
[b]Arcade Mode:[/b] You have 100 lives and an unlimited number of checkpoints.
[b]Easy Mode:[/b] You have unlimited lives, but you score less points.
[b]YOLO Mode:[/b] You only get one life.
[b]Speedrun Mode:[/b] You have to try and beat the game as fast as possible.
[b]Remix Mode:[/b] 8 additional remixed levels.

The main game has 16 levels, while Remix Mode offers 8 additional remixed levels. All of which are short, but moderately challenging. There are a lot of indie platformers out there that are ridiculously hard. This one offers a challenge, but doesn't feel impossible to beat. Unless of course, you're playing on YOLO mode. That really does feel impossible at times. As I said, the game is short. There's even an achievement for completing the speedrun in under 12 minutes. That should give you an idea of the length of this game. Still, it took me a little over 5 hours to get 18/19 achievements. It's also worth noting that the soundtrack is fantastic.

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
If you're a fan of platformers, I'd definitely recommend this. It's a short game, but it's well worth the price it's listed. If you're looking for a story, this doesn't have one. However, if you just want a good platformer that's moderately challenging, I think you'll enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111811696', 'num_games_owned': 1587, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1438201476}
review:
Учитывая низкую цену, я могу порекомендовать игру любителям сложных платформеров как приятную вещь, которую можно пройти за час. Игра вовсе и не сложная для тех, кто привык к нетривиальным задачам в платформерах; но я определяю сложный, или акробатический платформер как такой, который не ставит перед игроком тривиальных задач, обучая понятия прыжка, платформы, врага... Он обращается к уже опытному игроку, бросая вызов его накопленным навыкам. Так и этот платформер требует выверенных прыжков и удерживания в поле зрения многих движущихся объектов. Надо сказать, что 16 уровней игры отличаются достаточно сильно, и на них встречаются препятствия, которые редко увидишь в собратьях по жанру. Но сами уровни короткие. Тут в другом обзоре подсказывают, что это признак игры для любителей спидрана - состязательного прохождения игр на время. Для меня это приятный час игрового процесс с чувством завершённости в конце (в отличие от похожей по стилю игры "Just Get Through", которая даже попала в одну распродажу с этой).

Несколько придирок. Когда герой прыгает, что в верхней половине прыжка он приподнимает ноги, из-за чего высота персонажа меняется. Игра, похоже, честно считает коллизии попиксельно, но всё равно это несколько смущает. Вообще пиксели в этой игре очень большие - самые большие из тех, что мне пока довелось видеть в современных полноэкранных играх. Но передвигать экран такими же здоровенными шагами вовсе не обязательно. Я бы не обвинила игру в нарушении духа эпохи, если бы экран скроллировался плавно и пиксели вылезали из-за его края согласно актуальному разрешению экрана. Тем более что в игре достаточно графики, использующий более поздние, по сравнению с эпохой Атари, технологии, такие как вращение спрайтов и те же попиксельные коллизии.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122692491', 'num_games_owned': 1104, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1560265080}
review:
Don't be put off if you don't like a challenge, this game offers a lot for the price!

Gameplay is very simple with you jumping around levels trying to reach the end while avoiding obstacles, such as spikes and bottomless pits. Each level is perfectly crafted for the jumping mechanics, with enough challenge to keep you coming back for more!

Replayability is quite high, with especially good potential for speedrunning. With the superb level design and simple mechanics it makes for quite the fun speedrunning game!

The most subjective part is the pixel graphics, which I personally like the look of but I'm sure others will not agree with. I'd personally recommend looking past the graphics and focusing on the gameplay purely.

[b]TLDR:[/b] Buy when you can, it is worth it for what it offers in challenge and speedrunning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077426945', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1437633187}
review:
AMAZING!
This game, is just amazing! 

Pros:
- The art style is awesome, very well done, the bit drawings are just amazing.
- The music, OHH the music is SO but SO SO good!!
- The difficulty is just PERFECT, not insanely hard, but not easy it's a good and fair challenge
- Various modes, so you won't get bored!

Cons:
- Only one, more levels? Though the replayabilty is very big, it could use some more levels I think.


Conclusion:
This game is just amazing, It's cheap, fun, and has an insane soundtrack I got it for 1,01€ but I swear this game is completely worth 2,99€ if not more. BUY IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069872909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1511075466}
review:
Lovely game. (really, no pun intended) It's exactly what it says it is and exactly what it looks like. Get from point A to B through a variety of pits and obstacles. Short and sweet, the levels range from easy to challenging. The user-created checkpoint system is a wonderful addition. Use it too much and your score will lower, use it too carelessly and you'll find yourself dying on respawn. It took me I think 5 tries to beat the game on normal mode. 

The game is drawn well. The soundtrack fits. The song that caught my attention was "Kid" (you can listen to them individually in the menu screen), which is BEAUTIFUL. Want to listen to it every day. <3

Obviously if you don't like platformers, this game isn't for you. If you do, try this out. It's worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037349732', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1437499132}
review:
Nice retro-stylized 2d platformer with high difficulty and nice respawn system (basically you 'quicksave' your position manually and when you die, you respawn there). Good music, nice retro graphics, few gamemodes (including some challenging ones for hardcore gamers)... Sounds like a great game. Unfortunately two things hinder the gameplay for me to the point where I'm really not interested in playing anymore.

1) jumping control - there's no momentum attached to your jumps. The moment you stop pressing your dpad, character just stops dead in it's tracks. Even Mario for NES had this momentum feature implemented. You know why? Because it worked...
2) levels design - you enter new area hoping for some fun platforming action and what you get is impossibly long horizontal corridor with few moving up and down microscopic platforms to jump on and spikes underneath. One mistake and you're dead, you can't set spawn point on the platform, so you have to keep trying, getting pretty bored and angry at this horrendous level design. There are lots of these kind of obstacles in the game.

So it's a good game overall, if you have high level of tolerance for assholish platforming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043346855', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 630, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1517705997}
review:
It may not be pretty, but the game's tight design makes for a thrilling, surreal run.

LOVE invents a unique checkpoint mechanic that allows players to set them at will. Combined with a fun rating system and deep temptation from challenging levels, balancing risk vs. reward to decide when you need one feels amazing.

Abstract scenery and warm, quirky music set the tone for a simple, yet unforgettable platformer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059440294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1521382872}
review:
It is what I expected it to be: a short, simple but challenging platformer, and that's all I wanted from this game.
There's nothing much to it other than that you have to move to the left, right and jump. That's it. I'm not bothered by that, in fact, I'm impressed on how creative the levels are for just these simple controls. You can also set your respawn anywhere and it's really helpful in some levels.

I had a lot of fun with it and I think it was worth the little money I spent

author: {'steamid': '76561198028357706', 'num_games_owned': 897, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1672506622}
review:
Hardcorowe platformery to coś przy czym łatwo stracić cierpliwość, ale Love zalicza się do tych mniej trudnych, chyba że jedziemy na trybie, w którym mamy jedno życie to już jest trudno. Love jest hardcorowym platformerem zręcznościowym, który jest nieco trudny, jednak nie jest aż tak trudny jak SMB, ale jednak trudny. 
Gra posiada 5 trybów rozgrywki: Arcade, Easy, Yolo, Speedrun i Remix. Dwie pierwsze i ostatni są łatwe, gdyż w 1 i 5(inne levele) mamy 100 żyć, a w drugim mamy nieograniczone życia, pozostałe są już wymagające, bo w 3 trybie mamy TYLKO 1 życie, a w drugim walczymy tylko z naszymi rekordami, trudność zwiększają też osiągniecia, jeżeli chcemy je zdobyć, bo niektóre wymagają zmyślności lub zręczności. Trochę o planszach, jak zawsze mamy od najprostszych po te najtrudniejsze i tylko od naszej uwagi oraz zręczności zależy czy zginiemy czy nie, a sama konstrukcja plansz jest w miarę dobra, choć niektóre miejsca na niektórych poziomach wymagają nie lada precyzji mimo wszystko da się pokonać bez utraty życia, a i mamy 26 poziomów(po 1 Kwietnia): 16 poziomów dla 4 pierwszych trybów + 7 dla trybu Remix + 3 z kuso w wersji demake. Dalej sterowanie. Jak chodzi o sterowanie to tutaj nie mam zastrzeżen, steruje się bardzo dobrze. Grafika w stylu pixel art bądz retro tutaj idealnie została zrobiona. Muzyka jest dosyć ciekawa i nie irytuje. Gra nie posiada błędów czy bugów, gra działa bez żadnych przeszkód i tylko prosty kalkulator nie dałby rady z tą grą. [strike]Gra ma dziwny problem z płynnością, gra z jakichś przyczyn zaczęła się przycinać, ale ciekawe jest to, że jak włącze przeglądarke lub użyje programu do nagrywania z Nvidia Geforce Experience, gra działa płynnie, co jest zarazem ciekawe i nie powinno mieć miejsca. [/strike] Po aktualizacji 1 Kwietnia gra działa w 60 FPS-ach, więc nie ma już problemów z płynnością.
Teraz przejdę do plusów i minusów:
Plusy:
+Ładna grafika w stylu retro
+Dobrze dopasowana muzyka
+Przyzwoite sterowanie oraz obsługa pada
+Różnorodne tryby
+W miarę sensowny poziom trudności
+Osiągnięcia i Leaderboards
+W grze razem jest [strike]23[/strike] 26 poziomów.
+Sekrety :)
+Stosunek ceny do jakości
Neutralne:
[strike]+-Gra ma problem z płynnością, ale jeżeli mamy odpalony jakiś program to gra nagle odzyskuje swoją płynność.[/strike] - Dzięki nowej aktualizacji wprowadzonej 1 Kwietnia(jak widać to nie był żart na Prima Aprilis) gra działa w 60 FPS zamiast 30, dzięki temu gra jest zdecydowanie płynniejsza i przyjemniejsza w ogrywaniu.
Minusów brak.
Podsumowanie:
Moja ocena to 9,5/10, po niespodziewanej aktualizacji, dzięki której LOVE śmiga w 60 FPS, wróciłem się przyjrzeć i w sumie teraz gra się inaczej, myślę że mogę polecić tą część, choć zdecydowanie bardziej polecam kupić [url=store.steampowered.com/app/578930/LOVE_2_kuso/]kuso[/url], które ma więcej poziomów oraz zremasterowane poziomy z LOVE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058760223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1438465074}
review: A very simple game, and where it lacks in originality and graphical fidelity it makes up for in fun gameplay and a really cool looking Atari-esque aesthetic. Responsive controls, fun platformer gameplay, and alot of well-designed and aesthetically pleasing levels. For $3 you'll definitely get your moneys worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994439950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1433645898}
review: While it is yet another retro-style platformer, it's a good one that reminds me of old Commodore 64 favorites such as Jumpman and Pharaoh's Curse. It's challenging in places but not overly frustrating. Nice music, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 1009, 'num_reviews': 689, 'playtime_forever': 1200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1200, 'last_played': 1433609117}
review: Fun little game. Actually kind of enjoy the aesthetic of it, as its cute watching the guy run. The platforming is definitely tough. The jump could be better, as it falls into the camp of unresponsive, when you run off a platform and jump you just fall straight down. Also gravity seems a little too strong and unrealistic, as when you jump to something you go back down super fast, making you miss jumps because you should go further. All of the levels are quite varied and interesting, with different mechanics. Unfortunately the game is super short, like 20-30 min, and I found myself wanting more. The ability to set custom checkpoints is a fun inventive new mechanic, although one 1 level it was actually gamebreaking, and because there is no saving progress, I had to restart from the beginning, so points against it for that. I played on the mode with infinite lives, because I wanted to enjoy the game. You can play arcade mode, with a set lives, and if you die you have to redo it all. I think that is how it is intended to be played but since the game is tough and you die all the time, I don't want to be punished and have to replay levels I beat because the developer is artificially inflating game length because the game is short. If you make a good platformer, I don't need lives, because I should start the level or part over, and if parts are tough I just replay them, not start a new game. Even though some idiots like replaying old levels they beat all over again, I am not one of them, so I reccomend playing with infinite lives, you'll thank me later. If it was longer and fixed up a few of the problems, would be a very good game. 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132311928', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1696952416}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013706662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1433423964}
review:
Would be a decent basic platformer but it's really short and badly programmed (20 minutes on my first try). Not only is the game locked to 30fps and the resolution settings for playing in windowed mode limited, but it seems the first time I turned the game on was a fluke because every other time I turned the game on, it froze my entire laptop within seconds and even gave it a BSOD. What's strange is there's an early freeware version of the game dating back from 2008 with different levels/sfx that doesn't have any of these problems, although the game window is excruciatingly tiny.

Play that version instead (if you can find it available to download anyway) and avoid this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031245170', 'num_games_owned': 818, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1611295393}
review:
What a great retro-style platformer. Quite a surprise...

Extremely fluid controls, solid and challenging level design. Sound and music are perfectly suited and not annoying.

For something basic, this is really about as good as it gets. Recommended to any fan of 2D platformers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106810138', 'num_games_owned': 2232, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1425542058}
review:
Precision platformers with a retro aesthetic are very common these days, but Love hits the right notes.

I'm not a fan of the genre, mostly because I'm not good enough, but Love accommodates the players looking for a more casual challenge with its excellent respawn system. Players are able to drop down checkpoints where they please (as long as it's on a stable surface), effectively minimizing the amount of redoing you'll need to do. Higher difficulties limit these checkpoints (or outright forbid them), but I loved (pun not intended) that there was a more friendly mode as well.

There isn't much else to say. The levels are varied and the game in total does not outstay its welcome.
I'd like respawn systems like this to be in more games, especially skill-based ones, it was definitely the highlight of this game for me.
Recommended as long as you don't expect length, a plot or an explanation of the game's title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055432766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1432088113}
review: Full disclosure I've only played the arcade mode, but that seems to be the main mode. Love felt like it didn't know what it wanted to be between a casual or hard platformer. The art, the length, and the fact that you can place your respawn at will give the feel that this isn't a hardcore platformer. However, the tight controls, level design, life limit, and if you lose the life limit being forced to start over makes this a precision platformer. Had high hopes for this game since I believe I am exactly the target audience, but I feel like there are much better options out there.

review:
Love é um jogo independente, desenvolvido por uma só pessoa, estilo hardcore plataformer (super meat boy).
Possui gráficos bem simples com uma estética parecida com atari 2600, audio bacana (nada espetacular) e uma mecânica muito bem implementada (importantíssimo para jogos do gênero)
Para quem curte desafio, e gosta de games plataformas recomendo!
Mais um game de bundle que valeu a pena!
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197994290446', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1430388340}
review: Great for the price. This game is oozing with minimalist atmosphere. The great music and well thought-out aesthetics have a lot to do with this. The platforming is a mix of undeniably easy and overwhelmingly hard. Each level has it's own perceptual personality with it's own level design philosophy to go along with it. The only problem is each of the levels are too short a lot of the time, which made me wish for more. I also wanted each level to have it's own soundtrack because each one fit so well with the levels you first hear them in. Once you go to later levels the songs end up being repeated which is a detriment to the overall feel of the game and the greatness of the earlier levels. All in all this game could use a lot more content but the base ideas for the gameplay and ambiance are all there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980940812', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1427022613}
review:
[b]Персональный рейтинг - 4,5 из 10[/b]

Бьюсь об заклад, когда автор игры Love Фред Вуд (он же Деревянный Фред) придумывал название для своей игры, он наверняка предполагал, что подобное претенциозное название будет употребляться подчас в самом забавном контексте. Например, "Вчера 5 часов играл в "Любовь", "Застрял в "Любви" на 2 с половиной часа". Или что-то вроде "Любовь" истрепала мне все нервы!" 

Я не рекомендую Love, потому что Love - это не игра, а виртуальный тренажер для оттачивания кошачьих рефлексов, молниеносной реакции и глазомера для решения сугубо одной единственной задачи - поднатореть в прохождении игр на время. Если вы убежденный сторонник спидраннерства и твердо убеждены, что любые игры на планете Земля создаются с целью пройти их как можно быстрее; если после прохождения каждого уровня в каком-нибудь платформере вы запоминаете и зазубриваете каждый этап, дабы потом включить таймер и поиграть наперегонки со временем; если вы готовы потратить миллиарды нервных клеток проходя и перепроходя один и тот же трудный уровень, падая, пытаясь снова и снова, лишь бы выиграть хоть одну единственную секунду; если вы мечтаете о зале славы в Awesome Games Done Quick и желаете однажды занять свое место среди местных корифеев, то Love - для вас. Для тех, кто, как и ваш покорный слуга, в вопросах скоростного прохождения игр предпочитает занимать позицию наблюдателя и склонен больше смотреть на старания красноглазых подростков, ведущих неравный бой с секундомером, чем самому принимать участие - следует с осторожностью подходить к "Любви", можете обжечься.

Отталкиваясь от названия, можно сделать несколько выводов, касательно ее содержания:

- "Любовь" - это просто, без экспериментов и игрушек из интим-магазина. Достаточно лишь одного броского взгляда на картинки из "Любви", чтобы понять, что абсолютно ничего интересного там нет. Предельно статичные, грубые, одноцветные декорации с минимумом анимации. Собственно, анимированы здесь лишь только всевозможные механизмы, наподобие выдвигающихся шипов или вращающихся дисков, от которых следует держаться подальше. 

- "Любовь" - это быстро, очень быстро. Никаких прелюдий и предварительных ласк. Берите ее за волосы, особо не церемонясь - и вперед. Игра всеми способами подталкивает вас увеличивать темп, бежать быстрее и быстрее. Слоупок может не рассчитывать на достижения и высокие ранги. Чтобы заработать высшую оценку в A++, придется постараться. Я уже молчу о том, чтобы уложиться в 10 минут (именно столько времени отводится на скоростное прохождение. Не уложились - ничего страшного, но о достижении и призовом месте на доске почета забудьте).

- "Любовь" не длится долго. Увы и ах, но приятные минутки, страсть и признания про полной Луне иногда уходят так же быстро, как и приходят. Игру можно пройти буквально за 25-30 минут. И это при том, что если вы на пару минут решите остановиться, почесать там, где чешется, вспомнить, что забыли убраться в комнате, пару раз посмотреть в окно и, свернув игру, проверить, когда там наконец докачается ремукс "Интерстеллара". Не исключаю, что даже после всего этого у вас еще останется несколько минут свободного времени.

Что имеем в итоге? 16 уровней пиксельного безобразия, разукрашенного в разный цвет, практически полное отсутствие оригинальных гейм-дизайнерских решений, главный герой о десяти пикселях и небольшой, но неплохой полигон для отработки навыков быстрого перемещения в компьютерных играх. Если, прочитав последнее предложение, у вас задергался левый глаз - берите не раздумывая. 

Любовь - это вам не игрушка. Не играйте в любовь.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994987401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1483929488}

Have you ever played with a apple II? Those awful graphics and colors? Well this is a game for you! But instead of awful music, there are songs like no other apple II! Now say good bye to your old computer and replace it with a game on steam!
Now people that rage just because you can't beat the level are going to hate this game! I like it, but I will not recommend because of the difficulty. But I can show you the story!


STORY: This guy named Bob (Because he looks like him.) wants to go to gumstop because he can see the view from gumstop. You must adventure to on top of buildings to... Construction sites? Just to buy a steam giftcard doesn't mean you have to die! You can beat the game without dying but its nearly impossible. And I mean Impossible! this game wins the award for the most hardest game of all time!



GAMEPLAY:
As you try to go to gumstop, there are springs. You couldn't of beat the game without these springs.


I am not going to do the rating because it's hard.
