author: {'steamid': '76561197999338782', 'num_games_owned': 5564, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1398623933}
review:
Love es uno de esos juegos simples que acabas por amar o aborrecer, sin termino medio. En mi caso me ha encantado. Me recuerda al VVVVVV pero un poco menos frenético. Uno de esos juegos que te enseñan que el apartado gráfico no lo es todo y lo jugable puede hacer que un juego sea una tremenda basura o un gran titulo. En este caso, triunfa.

Simple, rápido y directo. Inicias, tienes 100 vidas y hasta donde llegues. Ya esta. A partir de ahí es mejorar, pasarte los niveles sin morir, sacar los logros, encontrar los secretos, hacer algunas hazañas complicadas y luego, si tienes valor, completar el juego con tan solo una vida (Misión imposible xD).

El aspecto gráfico le queda genial, no esta sobrecargado y los niveles tiene cierto trasfondo, algunas partes son un poco confusas pero se disfruta.
Ademas, el titulo tiene una música muy buena que le pega genial.
 Adictivo, en cuanto terminas de jugarlo ya sea por que se te agotan las 100 vidas o por que llegas al final quieres volver a intentarlo para sacar mejor puntuación y logros.

Por 3 euros lo compraría sin dudar. Si lo ves por menos, es una compra casi obligada si te gustan este tipo de juegos.

Lo bueno:
-Es un juego directo, sin intros que no pegan nada o tutoriales liosos.
-Simple a la vez que complejo, puedes pasarte el juego a la segunda pero no podrás conseguir pasártelo sin morir... nunca xD
-La música le queda perfecta.
-Rejugable.
-Editor de niveles, en este tipo de juegos siempre es de agradecer.
-Control con mando bastante pulido.
-Aun que esta en ingles se entiende todo a la perfección.

Lo malo:
-La duración, para variar. Si no te gusta sacar logros y eres de los que se pasa el juego una sola vez te va a durar, como mucho, mucho, una hora. Si por el contrario vas a sacarte todo, puede durar 2-3 horas como mucho.
-Se echa un poco en falta algo de mas contenido. Pantallas oficiales o mas logros para extender la vida del juego.
-La accesibilidad a las tablas de clasificación y el editor de mapas, ambas cosas un poco escondidas.

Conclusión:
Si no lo tuviese ya, por 3 euros me lo compraría otra vez. Si te gustan juegos de plataformas y algo desafiantes (VVVVVV, Bloody Trapland etc..) este te gustara, es igual que los anteriores mencionados pero un poco mas relajado.
Perfecto para echar una tarde muerta y volver a rejugarlo pasado un tiempo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020125851', 'num_games_owned': 15680, 'num_reviews': 840, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1456782110}
review:
+ Calming / Atmostpheric Music
+ Nice Retro style graphics
+ Custom checkpoits so you don't have to constantly redo parts when you die.

- Very Short (~10-30minutes to beat the game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198069737373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1398091868}
review: Awesome classic platformer which reminds me of 140 and Electronic Super Joy. Very short and simple, you may be able to finish it in 10 minutes after practise but I'd much rather be engrossed for 30 minutes than spend 15 hours grinding through filler content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034559066', 'num_games_owned': 1120, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1398087144}
review:
딱 보면 멘붕류 플랫포머 게임인데.. 난이도는 쉬운편..
기본적으로 리스폰 위치를 아무 곳, 아무 때나 설정이 가능해서.. 계속 죽다보면 꾸역꾸역 전진이 됨..
난이도를 낮추는 대신 적게 죽으면 높은 등급을 받는 방식이라..
이런 게임 잘 못하는 분들도 그냥 계속 죽으면서 전진하면 생각보다 쉽게 클리어 가능..
다만 처음했는데도 20분만에 클리어 가능한 짧은 분량은 아쉬움..
그리고 진짜 멘붕을 원하는 하드코어 유저들(아이작을 100시간 넘긴 유저라든가..)한테는 너무 쉬워서 감점 받을듯..

author: {'steamid': '76561198057537722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1402146762}
review:
Рекомендую ли я любовь к употреблению и распылению, если под "любовью" понимать небольшую игрушку Love продолжительностью в десять минут, озадаченную парочкой цветовых гамм и использующую шип как универсальное средство наказания начинающего игрока? Я буду до тошноты загадочен и отвечу на этот вопрос где-то в конце.

Love - пара-тройка-четверка-пятерка десятков мегабайт (что-что?), умещающая в себе около 15 уровней минимальной степени замороченности, отчего счастливые покорители Super Meat boy пройдут ее одним пальцем, используя при этом только боковое зрение. Для людей попроще Love - очищенный от всех шкурок и косточек плод платформера, который требует от игрока только бежать и прыгать, ни диалогов, ни принцесс не ожидается даже в патчах. 

Каждый новый уровень предлагает свежее препятствие и методику, расставляя самые разнообразные препятствия в интересной последовательности. Предельно упрощенная графическая схема нисколько с толку не сбивает и кажется адекватным решением, для особо придиристых имеются локации красных тонов, желтых тонов, с белоснежными потеками и даже мигающими столбиками. 

Если шип в очередной раз врезается в задницу вашего подопечного человечка, то можно испытать в действии систему развесных чекпойнтов, которая заключается в том, что на любой ровной поверхности в любой момент времени можно установить контрольную точку и продолжать с нее после смерти. Это здорово упрощает игру на первое время, но заплывающий за буйки игрок обнаружит такие смертоносные режимы как "пройти игру с одной жизнью" и "speedrun mode". Благодаря скоротечности игры, которая понимающе ни на секунду не задержит рвущегося вперед игрока, усиленные тренировки и покорение таблиц лидеров становятся вопросом времени. Грань между отсутствием явной сложности и режимом "одна жизнь" плавная, не в свою степь залезть просто невозможно. Подходящий под все это дело саундтрек действительно радует, но до поры до времени, когда концентрация и тишина становятся необходимым условием.

Love - это просто старая и короткая песня на старый лад по скромной цене. Да, я рекомендую игру к ознакомлению любителям инди-творений и несложных, но прилипчивых платформеров. Игра настолько скромная по всем фронтам, что после благополучной посадки на шип вы даже не будете кидать джойстики в форточки, например, я просто молча нажимаю Alt + f4 и иду в холодный душ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108870227', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1452163309}
review:
Перед всем текстом скажу только лишь одно. Игра стоит своих денег. 

Пред нами обычный платформер со своим видом и всякими особенностями. Одной из особенностей является отстутсиве 'мобов', т.е. игрок прыгает\бегает\скачит без всяких преград, не считая ландшафта и относящихся к дизайну уровня деталей. На одно прохождение уходит сначала минут 15-20, при этом уровни меняются, но лишь своими деталями. Концепция игры остается одна. Но есть что-то странное в игре, что тянет поиграть в нее снова. Я бы назвал это 'атмосферой'. Очень приятная игра, которая не вызывает 'ОСОБЫХ' трудностей, но при этом не без своей доли сложности. Маст хэв. 

Плюсы: 
+Неповторимые уровни.
+Пока что альфа, т.е. многое может измениться\добавиться. 
+Цена не завышена.
+Атмосфера.
+Индивидуальный саундтрек к каждому уровню.
+Поддержка геймпада. 
+Ачивки.
+YOLO режим, это для любителей хадркора. 

Минусы:
-Слишком маленькая.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048606714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1398885101}
review: Шикарная игра, хардкорная при 1 жизни, дорогие карточки.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970705636', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1705685424}
review:
Quite intrigued from the sound of it, you buy yourself into a world of platforming with a not quite fleshed out concept. Love is arguably the most bare-bone platformer you will ever encounter, and I'm talking beyond ImagineMe-level of basic. The levels mostly are free of thematic consistancy. And although you can notice a certain degree of development within your environment, it deosn't build up to anything.
The save state function seems to be more of an excuse for the clunky controlls and awkward unrebindable keymapping.

Wait for at leat 50% discount on this title, and till dev put some gradients into the color-scheme.
3$/€ is way too much to ask for a flash game!

review: I only played for 45 minutes. It's short. I finished the game in that amount of time. I am not saying Love is a bad game which it's not. I am just saying there should be more levels. All you do is beat one course and then you are done. The music in love is okay. I didn't find any of the songs stuck in my head I found them floating in one ear and out the other. There was one level when the music was so....I don't think I should say "bad" but I wanted to finish the level so I wouldn't have to hear the music! The levels are hard! I found myself dead at least 300 times. Overall if you want a game that is short tand is a platformer. This is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033497693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1396670502}

author: {'steamid': '76561198042311190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1394142034}
review:
This game is freakin' EXCELLENT, man.

The controls are tight, the '100 lives' mechanic is a great concept, and the music is excellent.  I'm a huge fan of the respawn system - you can set a respawn point whereever you want, which keeps the game moving forward nicely even if you're finding a section difficult.  The visuals are very minimal but pleasant to look at regardless.

A playthrough of the game is short, for sure, but it's cheap and it has LOTS of replay value - the main challenge comes in beating your own time and score, doing a speedrun or trying to beat the monstrously difficult YOLO mode (it's so hardddddd).  

That said, although I'm really enjoying it, it would be nice if some more levels were added in the future.  It certainly wouldn't hurt.

If you're a fan of challenging platformers like Super Meat Boy or VVVVVV, there's no excuse for not owning this, cause it'll be perfect for you.  If you're on the fence, just buy it.  It's fun, it's cheap and it has more than enough replay value to make up for its short run time.  

I LOVE it. 

...get it?  Ahahahahahahahahaha *sigh*

author: {'steamid': '76561197963057362', 'num_games_owned': 4656, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1395048459}
review:
This is a strange mix for me personally, that I genuinely enjoy so far. The music is comforting and relaxing and the deaths do not punish you as any level platform you can set your respawn on with no penalty to gameplay. I played it with my 7yr old son who picked up each levels mechanics so fast it surprised me seeing him finish a few levels when I was playing was a great experience.

The levels look simple, accuracy is the key and the layer movement is totally in your hands allowing you to correct the trajectory as you go (which also means, when you die it is your fault, and not rage inducing).  The aesthetics are perfectly suited to the game and I have enjoyed this a lot more than I feel I would have.

If you are after a fun platformer that will reward your persistence and attention to the levels, this should draw you in. Super Meat Boy is a comparison but I don't feel it is a fair one as SMB relishes punishing you at every turn to make you respawn and repeat (giving you surprise and cheap feeling deaths) this on the other hand has few of these so far and the mechanics feel solid.

I played this with a 360 gamepad and controls were perfect, the sense of movement really felt spot on and accurate.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975703239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1455378974}
review: A fairly easy platformer with a very pleasing aesthetic that is meant to be a short bitsized game. An appetizer of an appetizer if you will. These days where games are a dime a dozen this is actually refreshing. Sure I'll forget about it years from now, but do you really remember that one game you played for 20 minutes in Toys R US when you were in sixth grade and had a blast with? I didn't think so.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972839526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1463979683}
review: The Music.. the music! Gahh. I couldnt get over how much I enjoyed playing this game. I'm going to say half of my enjoyment came from how good that music was and how perfect it was for each level. Running and jumping never felt so good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024805655', 'num_games_owned': 609, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1637772432}
review:
Love is a fairly difficult precision-based platformer with a retro/pixelated aesthetic. Simple in concept, excellent in execution.

It's short, completable within 15 minutes, but the replay value is very high due to performance-based achievements, online highscore boards, and speedrun mode (focusing purely on speedy completion times). The controls are very tight, and the manually placed respawn points are a neat mechanic that adds a bit of depth to the gameplay. Love's level design is very appealing and flows nicely, despite a couple of difficulty spikes here and there, and the retro theme is brilliantly complimented by the game's soundtrack.

The only real gripe I have is how a couple of levels require an ounce of memorization, leaving you with no way of knowing if you're leaping to your death if it's your first or second run. Other than that and the difficulty spikes I briefly mentioned earlier, it's hard for me to give Love any more serious criticism.

For $3, fans of platformers or challenging games in general will not be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058884675', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1544301491}

author: {'steamid': '76561198067845679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1487652494}
review:
[b]Love is great.[/b]

Ah, [b]Love[/b]. A platformer that reflects mountain king and various other platformers for Atari and MSDOS systems. It was a joy for me to see this. To see that someone focused on simplicity other than making the next cookie-cutter movie production, I was excited to buy this.

The game is addicting, difficult, and charming, in the simplest of ways. For one, there are no cheap deaths. You can get past any obstacle, and beat any level if you just practice to know what's coming. Another great thing about it is the respawn system, nice touch for a platformer of this style. Most of all though, I love the soundtrack. I calms you down if you're about to rage from a death. Good stuff.

Overall, [b]Love[/b] is a great game that you should just buy. The job that the designer did on this game is something I really appreciate as a dev myself, and you should as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072296789', 'num_games_owned': 2452, 'num_reviews': 372, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1394263040}
review:
Love... ein spiel das nie gefunden werden will zumindes in youtube ^^ 

das game ist ebend altbaken wie jeder ja siet , und das was da gebohten wirt giebt es 100000 mall auch in anderen ez!
wieso kaufe ich es mir dann? 
wegen dem da bei steam steht ( enthält level editor ) 
dachte hee da kann ich ne neue eigen ide von level bauen , nach etlichen suchen habe ich verstanden wie es geht!
durch ein freund:  das man nur ein level selber erstellen kann ( Gering und kompliziert ! ) mit paint und dann ... und dann...
entscheidet das game ob es geht oder nicht ^^  bitte ein tutorial was es mehr erklärt als das wie im forum und wie man fallen einbaut! wasser tropfen ez!  ein neuen start und endpunkt . danke !!!!  

jetst nochmal zum game:  es lesst sich leicht steuern , leichter als es aussiet!  und es hatt viele modi die aber nicht grade sher abwexlungsreich sind ! da mehr drinne gewesen wäre wie man in paint siet ! sollte einer mal ein eigendes level machen !!!
aber sonst gans ok für den preis ( geschmacksache ebend alles und ansichtssache )

PS:Gebe daumen hoch da ein editor nur nebensache ist!  und der hier schlecht ist!!!! da es kein editor ist sondern ein manipulation tip der stage 1-10  in dem man die schohn erschaffende stage nur bearbeitet !.

doch das game an sich ist nett aber so wirklich begeistert es mich nicht , und 2.99 zu Teuer in mein augen !
da sind flash games kostenloss und bieten das selbe !!!
tut mir leid darum daumen runter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001716361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1531199559}
review:
Love hurts, love scars, love wounds and mars any heart not tough or strong enough. To take a lot of pain, take a lot of pain; love is like a cloud, holds a lot of rain (contaminated rain). Love hurts... when the game ends too soon. 

Either way, the song Love Hurts describes this game quite well, it's a great game for speed running and relies mostly on jumping, running and completing the game as soon as possible. For more of a challenge, there's also a YOLO mode where you can only die once. Pretty good game with an Atari-like world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042324050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1423877402}

author: {'steamid': '76561198064549326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1394413736}
review:
While I loved the minimalistic retro visuals and the quite unique soundtrack at first, it got to the 50th respawn before it got tedious. Now I've played They Bleed Pixels, and Super Meat Boy, so I knew what to expect when it claimed that it was difficult, but those games kept things interesting. Love just feels like it's missing something, maybe I'm just not ready for it yet. 

Love is a cruel mistress afterall.

Maybe I expected too much, in which case the game is not at fault. All I can say is if you like challenging platformers that may induce rage, this is for you. For the price, it's a little game that'll pay back in curse words and eventually fist pumping joy - go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047988034', 'num_games_owned': 2204, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1408289687}
review:
Retro look? ✓
Chiptune soundtrack? ✓
Replayability? ✓
Fast-paced gameplay? ✓
Ranks? Achievements? Speedrunning? ✓
Challenging (but not cheap -except in two spots on level 1- nor frustrating) difficulty? ✓

Its simplicity is its best offer. In this platformer there are no upgrades or foes, the environment is your only enemy in the 12 levels of the game. It has a great original feature: you can save (nearly) wherever you want, as long as you're standing on a surface (like savestates in an emulator), but the more checkpoints you create (and the more lives you lose), the worse your final rank will be.
You can select between infinite lives, 100 lives or 1 single life.
It's very short (there's an achievement for completing the game under 10 minutes) but if you're going for all achievements or simply getting a good rank it will keep you entertained a few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076721797', 'num_games_owned': 915, 'num_reviews': 778, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1404415271}
review:
This is a game that exists for replayability's sake, so if you don't like that kind of thing, just don't even look into it, it's about 15-20 minutes for your firstt playthrough and even less for further playthroughs, and not worth it if you only plan to play it once.

If you're crazy like me though and like replaying games to improve at them this one certainly does a nice job applying that concept. The respawn system and level select both help in learning the levels and the levels aren't stupidly precise or really too challenging your first time through anyways. There's a few issues with blind jumps but aside from those it's all pretty great. Each of the 12 levels is unique and the developer did well to cram as many ideas as possible into a small game like this. The graphics are also pretty nice for their style, not blocky and ugly like a lot of games adopting a "retro' style feel they need to be. I mean yeah it's pixellated and all but whatever.
Neat little game, and for the price I can't help but recommend it.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197998785170', 'num_games_owned': 1759, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1392481584}
review: It's always a good sign when I forget to either keep playing a game or retire it for a couple weeks straight. I did genuinely enjoy playing through this a couple times, and I was at least considering sticking with it a bit longer to improve my time/die less, but it completely slipped my mind after a day or so. Guess it made less of an impression than I thought. I do like some of the level design, and the respawn mechanic and extremely generous number of lives make it relatively easy to complete the game but incentivize you to not abuse either if you want to be competitive at all, because you're penalized if you do. That's pretty well thought out and makes it very accessible to learn the level layouts but still requires a decent amount of skill to do well at. Yay for good design decisions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022997080', 'num_games_owned': 2142, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1393251466}
review:
Fred Wood's [i]Love[/i] is one of the most outwardly basic looking games you can find on Steam this side of Super Hexagon. Its visuals don't exactly demand attention, and to an outsider probably seems just another soulless 2D platformer which would be better served adorning a no-name website as a free flash game than something they'd want to pay for. But like the polygonal twitch-fest I mentioned earlier, what sets Love apart is its attention to detail; the way it feels, how well each level is designed, and the potential that waiting just below the service that make it far more than the average browser-based diversion.

It shouldn't be unexpected, but you should know Love is not a long game. It consists of twelve short levels which can be blown through in about 20-30 minutes your first time. This is intentional however as you aren't meant to playthrough the game once and be done with it, but return again and again to aim for higher scores, faster times, and a better ranking. This is the focus of Love and why the short levels work so well; it makes it extremely easy to jump back in for a quick run every now and then to better your time, without having to commit hours to what could potentially be no better than the last time you played. I'm not typically a fan of speedrunning, but I've already gone through Love four times and definitely see myself coming back for more.

None of this would matter though if it wasn't for how well constructed the different aspects of Love are. Each level is unique in both structure and visual design, and yet they fit together perfectly and compliment each other with their diverse layouts. Similarly the graphics are very basic, but there's a subtle elegance to the way the character moves; how the different environment colors contrast to outline traps and the path forward and how the excellent soundtrack perfectly matches the mood of them, from melancholy ambiance to hyperactive electronica. The controls are sharp, whether using a controller or keyboard (the latter of which I rarely will even attempt to use), and something about the way you move just "feels right".

I'll come out and say I, ahem, Love [i]Love[/i]. It surprised me with its addictive and refined design, and has me eager to see what developer Fred Wood has planned for future updates. There is a ton of potential here for such a seemingly simple game and I have no doubt he is going to tap into it, already showing an admiral dedication to patching out bugs and adding in features that didn't make it right at launch. Love might not be a long game, or a very deep one, but it is certainly a very enjoyable little slice of platforming that is well worth the very low cost of admission.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037900375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1442843931}
review:
Hard yes.

Fans of Quick-Play or Speedrun games and traditional Platformers shouldn't shy away from this game. Sure, it looks like it belongs to the Pre-Commodre 64 era (Pre-8 bit for you youngins), but that doesn't hurt it one bit; the dangers and other elements are painfully clear due to the simple contrasts of the restricted colour scheme and well, if you need your 2D platformers to be pretty all the time then you should turn away now.

Love, by Fred Wood & Co., is built to challenge your classic platforming co-ordination and that's mostly what the game consists of, careful timing and just enough foresight and momentum carries the day... or your avatar into death. Rather than use a checkpoint system at set flagged locations like many classics, Love differs in that you can set your respawn points to conserve progress, and even goes so far as to include a suicide option that allows you return to your respawn. It's not necessary but it's handy if you're too bothered to retrace your studious steps; this mode is unavailable in YOLO mode because well, YOLO, but becomes useful to cover mistakes during Speedrun mode.

However, if you like your games longer, you should maybe look elsewhere; once you get better at this game, you'll only find yourself clocking it at faster times. If you take into account how long that might take you, well, then thats where this game really sells itself on replayability in the way that many old games with timers would, daring you not to die before it runs out... Only there's no timer counting down, just all the other players to beat... Or just yourself.

Pros:

-A challenging Quickplay, designed with 4 modes to cater to multiple player types: Easy for learners, Standard to try to keep 100 lives, YOLO mode for the Carpe Diem in you, and Speedrun for the obvious
-A brief but informative tutorial mode
-Features tight controls, unlike the era it imitates graphically
-Can toggle sounds/music on and off
-Can adjust to full screen (4:3) or scaled windows (1x-4x)
-Has a jukebox mode to listen to music
-Compelling melodic soundtrack, 12 tunes matched to 12 levels
-Oh yeah, 12 varying levels to master in the original, with an extra 10 added via Love + Custom
-Controller support

Neutrals (AKA matter of taste/opinion):
-Atari 2600-esque Retro graphics themes
-Cheap but well-priced

Cons:

-No adjustable volume controls, audio is either off or on
-No remappable/editable key or button inputs - anyone who doesn't like the control scheme will have to resort to other methods, persist or walk away from the game
-Lack of internal widescreen support may bother some people
-Love + Custom lacks controller support and the configuration features of the original executable

author: {'steamid': '76561197999340723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1482897061}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979036698', 'num_games_owned': 941, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1392598402}
review:
A great snack-sized platformer.  The trailer gives a good idea of what to expect in terms of minimalist pixel art and atmospheric soundtrack.  Each level has its own feel, and several introduce new gameplay elements - like moving platforms on a track, or falling through the "slow tube" and dodging spikes.

A clever game mechanic is that you can set a respawn point anywhere you stand.  If you use lots of respawn points, you can retry failed jump almost instantly, so the difficulty level is very gentle.  Or, you can try for an A (or A++) score, which means using few or respawns - that takes the difficulty level up closer to Super Meat Boy territory.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989384438', 'num_games_owned': 3309, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1392891520}
review:
"Love" is an endurance platformer with an Atari aesthetic.

First point to make is about the price. At full price, it's still cheaper than most games even with a big discount. The reason for this is that the game is very small. If you've watched the trailer, you've pretty much seen the entire game.

As is the way with most platformers, you simply jump through each level and make your way to the end. You can place checkpoints whenever and wherever you wish, but each time you do so will drop your score significantly. The main appeal of the game is to try and get the highest score (and lowest time) possible, fitting Atari gameplay with the overall look.

The whole game can be completed in well under 10 minutes. I was personally able to finish it in 9 and there was plenty of room for improvement there too. If you are looking for a lot of content, you won't find it here. This game is specifically designed to appeal to speedrunners and platformer purists.

The graphics are extremely basic. Each level consists of a single colour, plus black and white. This highly pixelled look is not just for show, it is to help with the precision platforming element where the edges of platforms are absolute. This makes unfair deaths by missing platforms because you didn't quite land on the edge practically non-existent.

The audio is similarly basic. There are a few chiptune-type tracks playing on each level but none of them are particularly good. Sound effects are sparse, mainly because nothing happens. Dying and bouncing on "bouncers" are the only times you'll hear anything. The few existing sound effects fit the theme well enough.

It's hard to give a recommendation for this game because there is a limited audience for it. If you love platformer games and want a game to properly test your skills, this is the perfect game to do so. It throws enough variety in level design to keep you on your feet and encourages you to keep trying to get that perfect score.

If there were ever a graduation exam for platformer gamers, this would be it. A gauntlet of differently laid out levels that must be conquered in a single sitting, with a no-nonsense audio/visual theme and some simple, yet tight controls to boot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963247737', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1392857241}
review: It's hard to recommend love. On one hand, it's really adorable old school in it's graphics. It does really innovative things with it's respawns and I love the different modes. BUT, the controls seem to be purposely sluggish to emulate the old atari esque games and that is just unforgivable. If I'm playing a platformer, I want to feel like I'm in control of my character, but the jump button can be mysteriously awful, causing me to feel like my deaths were because of shotty controls than anything else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066951681', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1691605320}
review:
Mais uma vez o jogo prova que música é tudo...Como um jogo tão simples como esse pode ser tão divertido quando existe uma música boa e relaxante dentro do Jogo...É isso! 

Para os fans de plataforma recomendo muito, principalmente aqueles como eu que gostam de coisas simples e básicas, nada exagerado como os de plataforma em 3D hoje em dia...

Aqui não é nada difícil e complicado, tanto que em 30 minutos você poderá estar completando o jogo, mas o que mais chama atenção é como uma única pessoa conseguiu criar um jogo simples, divertido e que uma boa parte iria "se apaixonar" (por isso o nome).

review:
Плюсы: 
1)Хардкорная вещь, может тягаться даже с такими играми как SMB.
2)Реиграбельность, за счет малого кол-ва уровней
3)Наличие различных режимов игры, которые, в свою очередь, добавляют в игру хардкора (yolo, speedrun)
3)Приятный саундтрек, музыка не сильно напрягает, порой даже расслабляет.
Из минусов: непонятный дизайн уровней(картинка то детальная, то квадратная до жути), отсутствие сюжета.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023154119', 'num_games_owned': 5242, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1392415614}
review:
Nazwa może być myląca - to nie żaden symulator randkowy. Jedyna miłość, jaka tu występuje, to ta od autora do swojego dzieła, ewentualnie nasza do jego gry.

To krótka, ale trudna platformówka. Gra nie toleruje żadnych błędów i wymaga sporej precyzji, co przy bardzo szybko rozpędzającej się postaci może sprawiać trudności. Z pomocą przychodzi ciekawy system checkpointów - sami stawiamy je w dowolnych miejscach, bez ograniczeń. Jedyną granicą jest ilość żyć, zależna od trybu. Możemy mieć ich nieskończoność, 100 lub tylko jedno(Yolo Mode). Po utracie wszystkich zaczynamy całość od nowa, nie ma czegoś takiego jak save. Z drugiej strony, to tylko 11 plansz.

Grafika to same piksele, ale mimo to poziomy są zrobione bardzo ładnie. Każdy w innych kolorach, z różnymi kształtami. Jeden z nich to wnętrze gada - świetna robota. Muzyka, choć też jakby wyciągnięta z dawnych czasów, wpada w ucho.

Najciekawszy tryb to Speedrun, gdzie liczy się czas, ilość utraconych żyć i postawionych checkpointów. Bo ta gra jest stworzona do bicia rekordów. Krótka, nie tolerująca błędów. Ludzie uwielbiający rywalizację na liście rekordów powinni sięgać po ten tytuł bez wahania, tym bardziej że jest bardzo tani, nawet kiedy nie ma żadnych promocji.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022154407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1401436771}
review: You have infinite placeable respawns, 100 lives, and a labyrinth of 12 levels ahead of you. How far can you get? That's the concept. There's an element of exploration and satisfaction that comes into play from getting to that next level and having to figure out how to best solve the next given platforming challenge with the least number of deaths and respawns placed (not to mention speed, cause doing stuff fast is dope.) Before you know it you're finding the optimal paths through each level and building runs to try and improve your end game score. Of course, since the creed of this game is its minimalism, it becomes exponentially smaller the second you figure out a particular segment, and while some might consider this a flaw I absolutely do not. How long I played a simple game like this, how much thought I put into and how much pure fun I had with it is a testament to how great all of these minimalist pieces of it work together. And I'm still chasing that YOLO run! I love Love and I think you will too so just stop reading this and give it a dang try right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027211139', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1403197694}
review: I was very suprised about how much I enjoyed this game.  A clean and simple platformer, wiith a fun playing style.  Unlike so many modern platformers, the difficulty isn't set to 11, it is tricky but not impossible.  It is short, but timed playthroughs and the  various achievements add the playability, and the price makes it great value.  I also loved all the hidden extras, like short cuts and hidden rooms.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026528862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1392720493}
review:
ステージ3までやった感想
内容は見たとおり普通のアクションゲーム　トラップを避けながら突き進んでくだけ
とにかくむっちゃ死ぬ　難易度ノーマルが残機100だけど、僕はステージ2で40回くらい死んだから多分足りない
操作方法が弄れない上に移動が矢印キーと、普段マウスを握るだけの右手を使わされるので結構指が疲れる
3面までチェックポイントを自分で作れることを知らずに進めたので、ゴール目前で死んだ時は画面を割りたくなった
IWBTG、スーパーミートボーイ、VVVVVVなどが好きな人は買ってみると意外とハマるかもしれない

author: {'steamid': '76561198060329972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1392652714}
review:
Что нужно для хорошей игры?
Герой, верно. Ещё какое-то приключение. И… это основа основ. Остальное - второстепенное.
Примерно по такому принципу и создали разработчики LOVE. 
Игра – эталон минимализма. Начиная от внешнего антуража, который аскетичен донельзя, и заканчивая продолжительностью самой игры, которая довольно таки мала.
Хорошо это или нет? Тут уж решать каждому. Тем кому нравится современная графика или просто симпатичная картинка, игра не придётся по вкусу. Как и любителям закрученного сюжета. В игре его просто нет. Всё, что у нас есть - это герой и неказистый внешний фон. Мне, кстати, очень  сильно всё это напомнило Atari 2600. Есть незатейливая  midi музыка, довольно неплохо звучащая. Наш протоганист носится по комнатам с кучей ловушек, в поисках выхода. Откуда и зачем? Не известно. Причём приключения нашего странника скоротечны. Игра проходится за минут десять – двадцать. В зависимости от умения игрока. Хотя, для любителей сложных путей, есть уровни сложности, которые могут значительно растянуть процесс прохождения.

Рекомендовать данный релиз я могу любителям VVVVVV (очень уж они похожи в визуальном плане и по геймплею), любителям ретро (причём донесовской эпохи игростроя). 
Для остальных проект может показаться малоинтересным. 
И, ежели брать LOVE, то сейчас – на хорошей скидке. За полную стоимость товар не рекомендую (даже при учёте того, что с игры можно набить карточек).

author: {'steamid': '76561198122136641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1617532073}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060140920', 'num_games_owned': 1691, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1441054903}
review: Love is one of the best platformers I have ever played. Yes I mean it. This game has a basic but charming art style. The controls are tight and very responsive. Overall this game is charming. So far I love this game (See what I did there? xD). I would definitely recommend you getting this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063241796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1572223624}
review: This is challenging yet simple game and good very fun. Patience and quick reflexes are a must to master this game but you'll find muscle memory starts to kick in after a while.  The music is some of the best of its style I've heard in a game and put me in mind of the soundtrack to Cave Story+. I also felt hints of Terry Cavanagh's work in the graphical style and difficulty curve, though this is nowhere near as hard as VVVVVV, it's closer to 'Don't Look Back'. At £1.99 its well worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006588125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1575828491}
review:
Well I dunno about the game because I cannot play it...I keep getting this error whenever I try to run it.  http://lookpic.com/O/i2/536/C92KUOYL.png  Contacted the creator, Fred Wood (fred.t.wood@gmail.com), and his response was just that he had never heard of that error before.  If anyone else could help me out that'd be great...not to mention turn the negative review into a positive one.

UPDATE:

Changed from bad to good...Thank you for finally fixing the problem for me and works amazingly.  If you enjooy N+, I wanna be the guy, vvvvvv, or games of that nature the answer is yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991394700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1393479374}
review:
This is an exceedingly pretty game. The music is beautiful and the visuals are easily one of the better examples of retro graphics out there. 

The gameplay itself is quite good, the controls feel nice and the difficulty is at a nice level where you feel challenged but not frustrated. Unfortunatly the game is very short (~18min for my first playthrough) and quite of few of the levels feel like they should be longer. Despite that the game is great and I will definitly keep an eye out for more stuff from Fred Wood.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049762648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1423867500}

author: {'steamid': '76561197964410359', 'num_games_owned': 5234, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1705616892}
review: Jeu de plateforme minimaliste, d'inspiration graphique disons VVVVVV mais qui n'en a ni la difficulté, ni la bande son. Premier run (= jeu plus ou moins terminé) en 18 minutes, ici c'est certain vous n'en aurez pas pour votre argent, deuxième run on tente le speedrun direct (l'achievement est à 10 minutes), succès avec un run en 9 minutes 30, après il reste plus qu'à YOLO (finir le jeu sans mourir, c'est pénible mais sans plus, le jeu étant bien moins difficile qu'un meat boy à part un ou deux passage ou il faut assurer), et le dernier achievement est ... de mourir 999 fois :D Bon ben normalement il faut bien moins de mort que ça pour terminer, donc bon, scotch sur la manette et en avant vers le trou à côté du début ! Au final pour le prix je recommanderais pas, y a vraiment pas de quoi jouer longtemps, mais bon si jamais vous le récupérez dans un bundle et que vous avez une heure à tuer, ça peut le faire :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198105669094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1402749063}

author: {'steamid': '76561198089270908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1438524493}
review: Love is just one of those games that you can just go on for about 5 or 10 minutes and have a fantastic time. An old style platformer that is not too tricky nor to easy to play. Fantastic game that i would recommend to lovers of the likes of mario and such.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044053079', 'num_games_owned': 1186, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1435313454}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960451627', 'num_games_owned': 3565, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1401450335}
review:
難易度:低め
ゲームの長さ:短い
ジャンプとセーブポイントのみのよくあるタイプの棒人間ACTだがそれなりに楽しい。
しかしクリア後に一時的に評価が表示されるのみでゲーム内でスコアやタイムランキングなどのラダー表示機能がないので頑張ってもイマイチ張り合いがないのは惜しい。

author: {'steamid': '76561197974544461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1392519991}
review:
Love is a minimalistic platformer that feels like a shorter, more forgiving, more linear version of VVVVVV. Unlike the open-world levels of VVVVVV, Love's are completely "Point A to Point B" from one to the next. There's also a helpful respawn mechanic that allows you to manually place respawn points as you progress, making death less frustrating than in other similar titles. The game is fairly short although I consider that a positive (ideal for short bursts) and totally acceptable given the low pricepoint. Many people should have no problem finishing all 12 levels in under 30 minutes and more experienced players can finish in under 10. Despite the short length, there's a decent amount of replayability thanks to the scoring system that grades you upon completion as well as the speedrun mode. I was also fond of the excellent soundtrack which features a nice mix of soothing and uptempo.

In all, Love is a fun, simple, and well-designed 2D platformer without any unwanted filler. Absolutely worth the $3 pricetag.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963352726', 'num_games_owned': 3693, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1392437070}
review:
THEY CALLED IT LOVE BECAUSE RAGE WAS ALREADY TAKEN.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082134568', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1465264674}
review: Difficult little bugger this is. But the clever naming of "Love" made me think. Downloaded, played and immidiatley (I can't spell) HATED the game, the controlls were sensitive, and i kept dieing. That's a comon theme of this game. Dieing. Alot. I rage quitted a few times. Ok, 50 times. But eventually, I got used to the controlls. And I realized that it was not the controlls,it was the sheer dificulty. And that's when my love grew strong. (See what i did there?) From that point on this game had (and still is) me hooked. I love this really difficult game. I though would personally suggest mod support, button remaping, and a damn volume slider. Music is great, but either mealowed, or enraged me (Or my anger for it). I will recomend it. Great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012952042', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1392428363}
review:
Very short game, though, really throws you back to the older and simpler platformers. You jump, and you dodge. Very simple game for casual players, but can also be very fun for hardcore platform gamers like speedrunners (there's a speedrun game mode).

My only negative point is I wished the game was a bit harder at times, but I guess they made up for it with the game mode YOLO (1 life)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993974612', 'num_games_owned': 1413, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1392586667}
review:
シンプルで快適な操作性と親切な中間ポイントのちょいムズジャンプアクション
攻撃やダッシュ、壁ジャンプ、2段ジャンプなどの複雑要素は無く、ジャンプに全力
高精度のジャンプを要求されるが、そこかしこに中間ポイントを作成できるので楽
しかし、初見プレイで60回程度死につつ、僅か18分でクリアできてしまったほど短い

スピードランやランク認定、残機1モードなどやりこみ要素あり
箱コンならXボタンで任意の平地にいつでも中間地点を作れるけれど、
高ランクを取るためには中間地点を減らす必要があり胃がキリキリ
BGMが素敵

タイトル画面でF,L,Pを同時押しすると隠しモード

author: {'steamid': '76561198072813187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1639673453}

author: {'steamid': '76561198112270216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1395312140}
review:
This game is just beautiful even if they don't put that much colors. It is simple and addictive. It is on Early Access but it is even good.
I recommend this game for those who loves to play platformer games and for those who love to do speedruns. Oh yes the speedruns are EXTREMELY fun to do in this game.
Not only the Speedrun mode is fun but the YOLO Mode (Literally) is satisfyingly good if you beat it. But it gets pretty annoying if you died manytimes cos you have only 1 life. The game is not extremely hard like I Wanna Be The Boshy or Super Meat Boy but it is quite challenging to do on YOLO Mode.
Although, there is not much too explore and the game is short IMO. The game is sooooo linear. For those who like to find explore the beautiful atmosphere, THIS IS NOT THE GAME FOR YOU GUYS!
Anyways this game is fun with no storylines or whatsoever. (Oh and it is cheap too cos it is on the Early Access.)

I give it 7/10 MAN Pump

author: {'steamid': '76561197999757048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1422204305}
review:
This game has some serious poetential.
You can slightly, just ever so slightly compare it to the same objective of Super Mario. Complete the levels and do not fall.

I am aware it is being perfected, step by step in the making; but it was very worth the $2 it was on sale for at the time, and definitely provides some fun, and while may be a bit frustrating at times; it actually edges you to continue playing. It's especially great that you can set up respawn points (by pressing S).

Besides, #yolomode!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093708963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1395239893}
review: I haven't spent too much time with Love yet. Plan on digging into it today. However, from what I've seen, it's a gorgeous, tough-as-nails platformer with wonderful music and a minimalist art-style that really speaks to my classic side. There's a kind attention to detail when it comes to platform layout, and despite the difficulty, nothing ever feels cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981930321', 'num_games_owned': 8863, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1451332605}
review:
Uwaga, niniejsza opinia dotyczy gry w fazie wczesnego dostępu. 

Love, kolejny retro platformer, który dostał zielone światło od użytkowników Steama. Czy w tym zalewie platformówek warto dać szansę grze Freda Wooda? Zdecydowanie tak. 

Pierwsze co uderza po starcie gry to minimalistyczna, ale pełna uroku oprawa graficzna. Większość poziomów utrzymana jest w pastelowej kolorystyce przywodzącą na myśl styl graficzny gier z pierwszych automatów. Muzyka w grze idealnie dopasowuje się do oprawy graficznej. Ambientowe, retro brzmienia wpadają w ucho, a niektóre z nich wrzuciłem nawet do swojej playlisty. Każda z dwunastu plansz ma swój własny motyw muzyczny. Pozostała oprawa dźwiękowa w grze jest raczej uboga, ot kilka dźwięków, które usłyszymy po zgonie bohatera oraz podczas skakania na „odbijającej” platformie. Nie zaliczyłbym tej ubogości do minusów, bo dzięki temu nic nie zagłusza doskonałej muzyki.  

Przejdźmy teraz do najważniejszego elementu, czyli gameplayu. W Love sterujemy bezimiennym bohaterem, który składa się z kilku białych pikseli, generalnie jego wygląd doskonale współgra ze stylem graficznym otoczenia. W grze brakuje fabuły i celu, ot mamy przed sobą dwanaście plansz, które możemy pokonać w jednym z czterech trybów: easy (brak limitu żyć), standard (limit żyć wynosi 100), YOLO (jedno życie) oraz speedrun (w tym trybie liczba żyć nie jest limitowana, a nasz wynik po ukończeniu wszystkich plansz możemy przesłać i porównać z wynikami innych graczy w dostępnej tabeli wyników). Ruch bohatera jest idealną kopią tego, który został zastosowany w leciwym Super Mario Bros. dzięki czemu „czucie” skoków jest idealnie wyważone. Ciekawym elementem wprowadzonym w Love jest system ręcznego rozstawiania respawnów. Gracz za pomocą jednego guzika na padzie może „postawić” spawn point w dowolnym miejscu planszy. Moim zdaniem jest to ciekawe rozwiązanie i na pewno ułatwia rozgrywkę, niemniej jednak w trybie Speedrun każdy jeden rozstawiony spawn point obniża wynik.  

Love to krótka, ale bardzo intensywna platformówka. Jedno podejście może zająć nam od 40 do 7 minut co czyni ją idealną grą dla miłośników rywalizacji o najwyższy wynik. Sądzę jednak, że każdy fan platformówek powinien jak najszybciej zagrać w Love, bo to naprawdę znakomita pozycja.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122557037', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1515554334}

Maybe I'll get better with some more practice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085962531', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1460682570}
review:
I know this game is in early access, looks good from my dew minutes of gameplay, but there is a reason for only about 3 mintues of gameplay. I found the control scheme weird. Me, being used to the WASD & Mouse configuration, took me a bit to understand how to control the character. I found it hard to navigate the menu, not knowing you had to use the A key to proceed to that option. If there was a way you could rebind the keys, i think that would improve this game so so much.

Apart from that, all the gameplay i've watched of this game seems good, other reviews seem very positive, and it looks like an all round fun game to play. Would recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078369212', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1468530352}
review:
This game is beautiful.

While I haven't spent a great deal of time playing it, I will continue to play it for a long time that's for sure!
From the music, to the beautifully simple graphics, the game just flows, being able to set your respawn point was a neat feature too. Each level is amazingly designed, the graphics are so simple yet just mesmerising.
I bought this game not knowing what to expect as there were no reviews, boy am I glad I bought it!

If you love platformers and a bit of a challenge, then LOVE is for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073852342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1586448254}
review:
Bonjour messieurs, dames, et preparez-vous à entrer dans une dimension où les Jean-Kevin ce sont pendus depuis longtemps, où on y pratique le sadomashochisme et où les crises de nerfs sont devenue courant! Messieurs; dames, entrez dans le monde ... du platformer! *roullement d'tonerre*

Le gameplay de love est simple: 4 boutons: avant, arriere, sauter et quicksave! Le jeu est pour l'instant en "early acces", mais reste bien abouite pour l'instant, les niveaux sont variés, changant à chaque fois de level disigne et de gameplay, osillant entre les sauts au poil de fion et et les plateformes qui disparaient, n'est en moins, il n'est pas cliché, il aurait pue facillement prendre les niveaux eau,glace et lave mais prefere soit changer le designe pour que cela paraisse different (ex: la lave), soit completement virer les niveau a la c** (nan mais arreter quoi, les niveaux de glace, c'etaient pas marrant au debut, ca risque pas de l'etre aujourd'hui, ce que jeu comprend tres bien)!

Et pour les adeptes des trophés steam, comme moi, ces dernier sont asser retorce à avoire mais pas impossible, le jeu est meme fais pour etre speedrunner avec, par exemple, beaucoup de raccourice et un mode avec un chrono (qui s'appelent "speedru", on n'invente rien :) ! 

Il manquerait plus qu'un editeur de niveau, du vostfr et un scenar "portaleux" pour que le jeu devienne une bombe indée!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046438412', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1392629248}
review:
Думаю при слове "платформер" сразу вспоминается Марио и Супер Мит Бой. Вспоминается? Так вот забудьте. С этой игрой у них нет ничего общего. Там есть сюжет, который развивается вокруг похищенной возлюбленной, а здесь... здесь есть просто пиксельный человек и уровни, которые с седьмого начинают адски выбешивать. Играется всего лишь несколькими кнопками: стрелками, А и S.
Игра довольно интересная и позволяет легально купить любовь за деньги (хотя я так и не понял связи названия с самой игрой), а цена за нее довольна низкая - даже если вам она и не понравится, о потраченных деньгах вы плакать не будете.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009663620', 'num_games_owned': 2450, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1392407868}
review:
For a game that markets itself as a challenging platformer it needs a little more challenge, first go through I didn't realise I could place checkpoints and made it to level 8 on my 100 lives, then when I realised I could place them, on my second playthrough of the game I got all the way through easily.  Maybe there is a little replay value, and essentially it is a cheap game, but you might be better off with one of the other meatboy like games, or even meatboy itself.

Saying that though it is early access and could be shaped, but they claim all of the content that will be there is there, so adding length and more difficult later stages to the game would not do anything to aswade this.  Maybe with some user created levels in steam workshop this could have more longevity, but the whole point of a challenge game like this is to beat it, and I've done that easily, Im not one of these 1 life run people, but I expect the normal mode to offer more challenge than this in a game of this style. 

The game is also fairly linear so you have a single path through the game, whereas something like I wanna be the guy there are a number of other paths you can take as well as hidden secret items which extend longevity, things the developer can think of adding, and if these increase the game cost, I always say its better to make a good game that will be played over and over than a quick cheap one someone will play for 22 minutes and no more.

So at the current state, with 12 levels, which lets face it some of them weren't as difficult later as they perhaps should've been I cannot recommend this game unless its on sale and you fancy a cheap quick thrill.  There are other games of the type you'd spend far longer on with similar investment and have far more fun with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058093092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1393073391}
review:
Well, this is the second Early Access game I am buying after Electronic Super Joy. You may notice that both are hardcore platformers!

Anyway, Love is pretty difficult, but it has one redeeming feature - you can place respawn points along levels and whenever you die you restart from there. 

The 12 levels can be completed in around 20-25 minutes on your first playthrough. But there's quite a bit of replay value here as you attempt to then complete the whole game in 100 deaths or less, and then complete it in under 10 minutes. Finally, there's the objective to complete it without dying, but I'm not sure if I wanna put myself through that torture!

Graphics are just ok. Nothing to swoon over, but it does it job alright. I am personally not a fan of this visual style, but can live with it. Soundtrack is good. Some of the tracks are indeed memorable, but nothing ultimately out of this world.

Currently, there is an issue with the controls for me personally. Jumping while moving doesn't feel consistent. Hopefully it gets fixed and if it does I'll update my review here.

Is it worth $2 or $3? If you're a fan of platformers, I guess so. Some nice achievements to aim for and easter eggs to discover as well. Even if you are not a precision platformer fan, you can still get this as its infinite respawn points feature should help you complete the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033897409', 'num_games_owned': 1010, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1423601035}
review:
Вот что известно: сложность игры выбирается по количеству жизней. Изи: бесконечное, нормал: 100, yolo: yolo и speedrun. Довольно стильно, и музыка и визуально. Геймплей простой: вправо, влево, прыжок и чекпоинт (теперь мы их расставляем), ах да, еще можно суициднуться.
Уровни короткие, есть небольшой челендж в них, но он малоинтересный. Возможно из-за наличия редактора будут сотни интересных уровней, но эта вещь обычно для самых употорых. А еще было бы хорошо, если бы допилили хоть какой-то сюжет. Даже в VVVVVV была история, а не тупо платформер.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116262926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1618660671}

review: I love this game. I already reccomended it to friends. It may be short, but it's somewhat challenging as well. As the game goes along, it becomes easier. The music in some levels is to die for. It's short but it's in early access so I can't knock it. Waiting for a level editor and hopefully public levels. author: {'steamid': '76561198102041893', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1393736004}
review: The game has 12 levels, and they have unexpected deaths taht feel unexplained and absolutely not your fault. That ishorrendous design... More importantly. I bought this game for the level creator and there is none...

author: {'steamid': '76561198015030297', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1394940514}
review:
To start, I've had the pre-Steam version of Love for a while, and I'm happy to see it come to Steam.

It's a short game, though for the price of entry, it's very worth it. Fantastic old-school graphics and soundtrack. What flaws there are are being hammered out by the developer who seems fairly active and receptive on the game's forum.

In short, it's cheap and fun and well worth the $2-3 price of entry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019566790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1516398636}
review: For such a low price this is a wonderful stylistic game that I hope to see expanded through the Early Access program. It's incredibly short but encourages replays and has a magnificent soundtrack. It's a simple platforming game that lets you drop respawn points anywhere as you go along, aiding in the removal of frustration while playing. You're also given only 100 lives to complete the game with, which may sound like a lot but believe it isn't. This reminds me of a twist between VVVVVV and Super Meat Boy and that's a brilliant thing! For the ridiculously low price I wholeheartedly recommend this. My only criticism would be the music suddenly jumping around from slow and sensitive to fast and action packed and back again as it removes a lot of the emotions of the songs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034118715', 'num_games_owned': 4134, 'num_reviews': 508, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1392656742}
review:

といっても慣性やら助走やらに煩わされることもないので操作感は良好。

箱コンの場合、Xボタンで任意の平地にリスポンポイントを作れる。
それに気付かないままクリアしても何の実績も開かないから気をつけよう！
なんの縛りプレイだよｸｿｧ！　めっちゃ死んだわ！

author: {'steamid': '76561198097133399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1629486195}
review: This is an immersive, amazing, and a revolutionary "speedrunning" game.  Please buy this if you are up for a challenge, like speedrunning, or want to challenge your friend's high scores, especially being $2 now and $3 off sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111048238', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1396442746}
review:
Прежде чем играть в эту игру, подумайте, дороги ли вам ваши волосы на заднице. Они могут сгореть.
Проходя даже на изи, вы уже на первом уровне будете проклинать разработчиков. А на втором, как и я, забросите игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025321433', 'num_games_owned': 1160, 'num_reviews': 452, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1392662657}
review:
What is love? Baby don't hurt....oh, I am sorry. It is not about the song? Okay. Let me start over.

What is love? Well, when two people have certain feelings towards each other, they...what, that isn't the topic either?...

...oh, the GAME! Right...

Love is excellent. Fun, hard and forgiving at the same time. A retro-graphics platformer. (retro being pixels. HARD pixels. The bottom soil of the old era.) A playthrough is shorter than the love-kind-relationship that your dog and your guinea pig used to have, but it sounds better and is more fun, and doesn't destroy your furniture.

It has several game modes, one being the easy (e.g. cheap and no one plays it anyway) mode that gives you unlimited lives (yay, games!) but also a smaller score upon completion. Normal gives you 100 lives and you will get the normal (duh) scoring, depending on how many lives you have, how many spawnpoints you have set (YES YOU CAN SET THEM YOURSELF OMGSLJDESFS) and how fast you were - tons of replay potential.

For the upcoming sadists, there is a YOLO Mode. Yes, it is called like that. Die once and it is over. Pure madness.

And a speedrun mode, which arguably is the most fun mode because you can just get faster and faster and the game is visibly designed around improving your times and erasing mistakes and getting faster. Sonic would be proud, right before the spikes would bury themselves in his soft little fur. Just like your dogs teeth in your guinea pig.

But anyway, I am in love with love. It is a lovely loveable game. And you will love it too if you like tough as nails but fair platformers and highscores, and if you like to work on your mistakes.

I am out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058608602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1406288121}

author: {'steamid': '76561198090995941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1393165293}
review:
While this game may hold a title that is very Cheesy. It was hard to get over that I had to own this peice of Retro history. This game brings back the memories of my first console days, The days when gaming was taking off. I am glad that this game was made avaliable to Steam, Such a low price tag aswell.

Now this game may look desceving to the eye, But it has a sence of challenge, Will, Wanting to get pro. Wanting to achive that top score on the leaderboards. Wanting to furfill that quick speed run. This game includes a Level Editor, May mean that other players around the world can bring their dream of an Indie Game to life, but amoncst the Retro Style this game has to offer.

Words can'not explain how much fun this game is! It may not look like fun, but once you start it is to good to leave.

Features:
- Such diverse Levels.
- That freedom of not getting angry every time that you die.
- Having the fun gamemode to achive a Speed Run time, With in a Gamemode Difficulty.
- Great well peiced music that fits this style of game.
- Great Price! Only $2.99, You can't go wrong with this game.

"It Is a must add to your collection of games, If you currently don't own this game, Get to it!"
~ ThyItsFrosty

author: {'steamid': '76561198053568113', 'num_games_owned': 4851, 'num_reviews': 349, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1527313910}
review:
Well I did have fun while playing through it, but it's very short. 23 minutes 30 seconds to complete the game on normal mode. I know this is an early acess but it's very short nonetheless. There's obviously a few bugs with jumping and the graphics are made to be trippy in some stages ( I actually like the trippy graphics though. )

Due to the game length so far and how simple the game is, I cannot recommend this game. The game also has no level editor unless someone knows where to find it? It's not in my game/tools/folder and it's advertised on the store page.

When I can access the level editor, be able to share them with others and the base game gets more levels I will change my review to Recommended.

Update: As far as I know, the game had no updates in 3-4 months now and there's still no Level Editor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982588941', 'num_games_owned': 2570, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1415420947}
review:
Super Meat Boyのような、プレイヤーが上達してクリアするタイプのアクションゲーム
クイックセーブを使いつつ、
決められた人数（難易度Normalだと100人）で12のステージを通してプレイする。
Desuraで発売されていた時にプレイ済みだったが、
それでもとにかく短い（DesuraとSteam合わせて1時間もかからない程度）
レビュー時点では早期アクセス扱いなので、ステージがもっと増えるのかもしれない。
ゲーム難易度は難しすぎず、気軽に遊べた。

2014/2/8

author: {'steamid': '76561198002360985', 'num_games_owned': 1181, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1546735476}
review:
80年代PCを思い出す簡素なドット絵のジャンプアクション。
巨大キャラが回転しながら動くなど、当時なら無理だった様々なシチュエーションのトラップ、消滅する足場はBGMのテンポに合わせてジャンプするとうまく飛べるなど、独自の要素も多い。

だが、プレイヤーも障害物も動きがやたら速いうえに、わずかにずれただけで落下して死ぬわ、死んだら戻されるわ、当時ならこういうのはありだけど今はさすがに・・・

と思ったが、ジャンプと共にあるのが、死んでも戻るポイントを自分で作成するボタン。これを使えばトラップの直前に戻る事も可能。
言わばレトロ復刻ゲームに「どこでもセーブ機能」がある感覚に近く、この一つだけで劇的に遊びやすい。

レトロ風ゲームでも、わずかな要素を加えるだけで今でも十分に楽しめる、そんな可能性を見せてくれる。

author: {'steamid': '76561198067404244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1487024826}
review:
Love. There is a bit to say about this game. Many may be turned off by its simplistic graphics, but don't let this turn you away. 

While, yes, it is a simple game with even simpler controls. But, it's fun, and easy, to play, and with its gamemodes and gradescale it's a damn hard one to master. 

The game itself; if you'd rather just get through it without worrying about losing all your lives or going as fast as you can, is rather forgiving. I mean, whenever you're standing still you can set your respawn point. This is helpful, but there still are areas where you cannot save, and you'll have to make long stretches and rely on your timing and wit to survive them. Sometimes they aren't so bad, and sometimes...yeesh.

Also, I like the fact that it's a PvE game. Rather than fighting off hordes of enemies that wish nothing more than to blow up your little, pixelated stick figure, it is instead spikes, pitfalls, projectiles, and a rather...mysterious, volatile white ooze. This helps hone a mindset that won't let you blame bad enemy AI because, well, there are no enemies! Instead, you must very, *very* carefully. One slip or miscalculation, and you will fall to your death--either by spikes or by pitfall.

The game will also appeal very greatly to the speedrunning community. With its own mode with a timer, you can try to run through the levels as fast as you can and upload a score. Also, those who like achievements, this game has a decent 19 for you to strive to collect.

And the music.

Man, don't even get me started on the music. It goes so well with the game, it's just fun to listen to the beat. The songs are incredibly basic, and short, but they go to compensate with the rather short levels, so it's not so bad. 

My only *major* problem is that the game lacks a pause feature. I often try to leave an accidentally selected gamemode and I accidentally end up quitting the game, which can be a bit annoying. However, seeing how this game is in the "Early Access" category, and that it just came out today, I'm certain it will be put in soon.

Overall, Love is a great game. It's not a particularly long game, and it's not very hard to beat, but when you try to head for the top or to gather all the achievments, then prepare to be in a world of hurt. I'm talking Mega-Contravania kind of hard, with an Atari 2600-esque look and a kickass soundtrack to boot.

So, in my opinion, yes, it's worth the $2-3 you pay for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981047937', 'num_games_owned': 7453, 'num_reviews': 437, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1392498025}

Simple gimmick retro-platformer. If you like that, buy this. Hands-down wonderful, and the level editor gives you a lot of room to play with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113094944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1672188998}
review:
"Love" includes your generic options like windowed or fullscreen, muting of sound effects and music, etc. What I really like though, is how there is a sound check where you can listen to every single track individually, which is very nice. So now that that is out the way, allow me to review this game-

Story: There is no story. You are just a guy going through levels. Why? Well... who knows?

Gameplay: You are given 4 modes to play in- Easy, Standard YOLO, and Speed Run (keep in mind, there are 12, short levels in this game). In easy mode, you have unlimited lives. In standard mode, you have 100 lives. In YOLO, you have 1 life. In Speed Run mode, you have unlimited lives again, and a timer that times you throughout the entire game, giving you your total time when you finish. There are not many buttons in this game at all. You move left and right (Arrow Keys), jump (A), and set respawn points, where you will respawn when you die (S). On the Xbox 360 controller, you move left and right (analogue stick or D-Pad), jump (A button), set respawn points (X or B Button), and intentionally lose 1 life to respawn at a respawn point (which I don't know how to do on the PC contols) (Y button). As you have probably guessed, respawn points are critical if you are in easy, standard, or speed run mode. If you make 1 respawn point, the previous one you made disappears, and when you die, you will respawn at your most recent respawn point. From what I've played, it seems there was never a point where I respawned in a place where I will always die (I think since most things that hurt you move, this will probably never happen to you). Also, you cannot make a respawn point anywhere other than the ground. Moving away from that topic, once you beat the game, you are given a letter grade (A-F, like in school), depending on how well you did based on your time, and other factors (+ and - are used in thje score too. For example: A++). It's a bummer that you can't change the PC controls (keep in mind, I'm playing this on the day it came out), and to be honest, the PC controls are bit off compared to the controller controls. Seriously, this game was meant to be played on a controller (you can't change the controls for the controller either, but they feel perfect so it's absolutely unnecesary). If you haven't already gotten the memo, this game is simple (including the controls, level design, just... everything), and that is what this game holds as it's charming factor. Also, each level is completely different from the last, but I think there could have been different colors used, as I do remember 2 blue levels, 2 yellow levels (really, what's with the repetition?).

Graphics: Don't worry, you won't be needing a GTX Titan for this one. Simply put, if you have a modern, working computer, YOU CAN PLAY THIS GAME WITHOUT A PROBLEM. The graphics have a simplistic, retro, kind of look, and I love it. With so many games today that look so realistic, this is a good break. Honestly, I don't play video games to simulate a 'realistic' world I already live in. When I play a video game, I want an escape. I want a game that plays different, feels different, and just looks different. That's what I love about these Atari-esc graphics- it's just art to me. I feel like I'm really transported into another world in this game. You really do have to admire the blank, black bacgrounds, solid color obsacles, square pixel-like objects, a stick character with a funny looking head...

Music: Fantastic variety of tracks that are memorable. You have your techno, hip-hop and rap instrumentals, and many others relaxing and engrossing tunes that are just incredible. My favorite track is "Kid." 

Memorable Aspects: I love the simple and amusing menu sequence. Who can froget the animation where the character has his arms behind him as he races forward. The death animations are very creative too.    

Overall: The game has a charm that makes you remember the "Love" you had for older games (with the beautiful music, simple gameplay, and "different" graphics). Even though you have the ability to speed run the game, and there is a YOLO mode to keep you interested, the amount of content is minimal (there are only 12 very short levels!). And yes, I'm well aware the game is only $3.00 when not on sale, but c-mon, I would much rather have worthwhile content with HOURS of potential fun, instead of minutes. Really, I don't want to have to wait for "Love 2" to get more of this game after only playing for less than an hour. Still, I feel the really short amount of content can leave some questioning the price of $3.00, but when it's on sale, it is definitely worth it. I'm afraid I'll have to give it an 8.5/10 mostly beacause of the EXTREMELY, EXTREMELY, EXTREMELY small content. If you even remotely like platformers though, this should be in your Seam library right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970109141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1646639174}
review:
The first thing that you need to know is Love can currently be completed in around 15 minutes, most likely on your first try. While that isn't necessarily a problem for $2, you need to be aware that the main fun you will get out of it is trying to break that record on subsequent runs. Hence if you are not that type of gamer, it probably isn't for you.

Other than that, everything works but there is nothing exceptional about it. Basically it is what it is.
